items.name: Ultimate Planet Habitat Support Tester 2020!!
items.body:
Hello there young apprentice!
Today your skills as a Planet custodian will be teseted!
You have (almost) all the tools needed to have this planet survive as long as the cosmos will exist!
Remember not to run out of the planets energy and dont let all the creatures die!
Energy is restored to the planet from dead creatures.
Plants consume the energy of the planet to live.
Animals eat plants and eachother.
If you dont like a certain species you can eliminate them or change its behaviour, but remember, everything comes at a cost!

Controls:
Most things are done by clicking the left mouse button.
You can zoom with the scrool wheel od +/- on your keyboard.
To move around press the right mouse button and move the mouse or use WASD/Arrow keys.

Have fun :)!

Didnt have time for graphics :<

items.name: Lightest Dungeon
items.body:
Third Ludum Dare, first time with Unity and still learning so the scope of the game ended up being smaller than expected, but I think I still ended up with a fun game.

It's a strategy game Darkest Dungeon style, where you control heroes of your kingdom by sending them on different quests to save the princess of the kingdom from her illness. You need to manage their exhaustion, recruit new heroes and upgrade them while keeping your fortune from decreasing.

**Tools used**
- Unity (Engine)
- Aseprite (Graphics)
- Paint.NET (Graphics)
- Bfxr (Audio)
- Abundant Music (Music)

**How to play**
Only the mouse is used to play the game, there is an in-game tutorial that will appear when you first start the game.

Let me know your thoughts in the comments below, enjoy!

![2.PNG](///raw/02e/7/z/2c69a.png)
![3.PNG](///raw/02e/7/z/2c69b.png)

items.name: Sound Blaster
items.body:
Sound Blaster is a bullet hell meets music sequencer. Sound is everything to you. It is your movement, it is your score, and it is also your enemy. How long will you survive?

Instructions
Music files are generated at the end of each sequencer loop.
Drag music files onto your sequencer. 
The sequencer will play the file and produce music.
Music creates movement through propulsion of bullets. [Avoid bullets that head your way]

![Untitled-3.png](///raw/ee9/11/z/2c6ea.png)

Controls:
A: left rotation
D: right rotation
Mouse Interact: Left Click to drag files to your music sequencer.

items.name: Keep Her Happy
items.body:
â# Keep her happy
Your flower is withering with depression. Help her.
## How to play
You write messages to your friend who becomes more and more depressed as time goes on. Depending on the positivity of the messages, you help your friend more or less.
![Gameplay](///raw/deb/a/z/2c67b.gif)
## Context
The game uses sentiment analysis software to analyze the positivity of the messages you send to your flower. This sentiment analysis is from a [C# implementation](https://github.com/codingupastorm/vadersharp) of [the VADER sentiment analyzer](https://github.com/cjhutto/vaderSentiment) and I'm one of two people who have developed an in-review Danish sentiment analyzer, [SentidaV2](https://github.com/esbenkc/emma) along with tools for future development of the Danish sentiment analysis field. It's quite fun to use this in a game and it becomes a sort of citizen science project as well.

items.body:
The robots are gaining sentience and are trying to escape. Unfortunately they need to navigate their way through the facility before they can gain their freedom. They haven't developed spatial reasoning yet so you are the only chance they have.

Direct the robot through the maze by placing program blocks on the floor.

Instructions (Tutorial in Game):
Left/Right Click on empty block places direction pad.
Left/Right Click rotates (CCW/CW) already placed pads.
Get to the chequered pad to move on.
12 levels to beat.
Enjoy.

items.name: Rescue Mission
items.body:
Wow, I never knew you could get this much done if you just didn't go to bed! Lol, but yeah. I started drinking on a mate at around 8 o'clock, and I didn't get to bed until around 5:30. After an hour's nap I was up and at it again, and for the first time, I think, I had enough time to make something decent. Well, really, it's around the level of my Pogo Stick Granny, but there is an actual end goal and a graphic at the end that shows how well you did so that people can take a screen shot and show off.

Alright, enough talking! I'm currently waiting on a webgl build as I write this, and I've got to go make the itch page, so yeah. See ya'll in the comments maybe!

items.name: Confluence
items.body:
This is a shoot'em up game where you must protect a very valuable computer that has been placed in a fail safe after the space station it was housed in was attacked. It is now on emergency power and is vital to the survival of your species. You will need to gather and reconnect the 4 power supplies as well as protect the computer from the onslaught of enemies to survive. 

Controls:

Arrow Keys = Move

Space Key = Fire

When hit by an enemy or projectile you will automatically turn on a shield for a few seconds. You will be unable to fire until the shield is down. 
That's it!

items.name: Keep the King Alive
items.body:
Your king is threatened by fellow opponents and YOU are the only one that can keep him alive!

// Demo GIF here

As you can see, it's a strategy game, and your goal will be to properly control your units to make sure the King stays safe.

# [Play here!](https://noxalus.github.io/LD46/index.html)

# Controls

- Left/Right/Up/Down arrow keys or A/D/W/S: move left/right/down/up
- CTRL/R: Rotate the unit you are placing
- Left mouse click: Select/Place unit
- Right mouse click: Unselect selected unit to place/Move the selected unit to the specified location
- Middle mouse click: Pan the camera around

# Info

  - Second solo jam
  - Cumulative time spent: +25h
  - Tools used:
    - :tools: Game engine: Unity3D
    - :art: Graphics: Inkscape, Paint.NET, Magica Voxel, Blender
    - :control_knobs: Sounds: Bfxr, Audacity
    - :musical_score: Music: Bosca Ceoil

items.name: Dicelem: Rise of the Golem v0.9.0  - demoversion
items.body:
v.0.9.0 - demo version, since I was able to do only basics. 

Alchemist brought life to golem, but in order to keep it alive, the golem needs to be regain life force. Sadly, the life force can be obtained only from other living creatures.

To give golem chance the alchemist sent message to the world about the mighty and evil golem and that for his capture he is going to pay the hero weight in gold. To avoid any trouble he sent golem to the world and told him to return as soon as he will regain his life force.

You are in charge of golem. Life force can be obtained by killing the opponents. Mechanism is build based on dice - meaning you set how many dice you want to use for attack and how many for defense. Oppoennt will do the same and the result is then compared. If you kill the oponent, you gain rest of his life force. Both parties are dealt damage to their healths based on the difference of opponent attack and its own deffense. If you loose your life, you also loose the game.

Control:
w,s,a,d 
mouse -> click on opponent and you are going to see.

items.name: The Light Child
items.body:
So this was my first foray into game jams and LD, and I have to say it was an absolute blast! It's been quite a while since I've last developed any games, so it's fun to be getting back into it. 

My game is called "The Light Child". The main goal of the game is to keep the small fire creature alive (by feeding it wood and protecting it from enemies), all the while also collecting four orbs so that you can rid the world of the darkness it finds itself in. The game is definitely on the harder side, but if you're up for a challenge, then this game is for you!

Controls:
- Move with arrow keys
- Pickup/drop items with space bar
- 'z' to attack with the axe, or to feed the fire child wood pieces
- esc to pause

The game was made using Godot and all art was made in Aseprite (both of which I only starting learning on Friday :sweat_smile:). Unfortunately, I didn't get around to adding any music :(

I look forwards to participating in future Ludum Dares, and hope you all have fun playing my game!

items.name: Take Care Luda
items.body:
# Game General
## Description ð
You take care of Luda and her essential needs. If she wants something or she feels like she's had enough, she'll let you know. If you leave her alone for a while, she will not take care of herself. What a lazy bum! Everyone needs sleep and that includes Luda. She's asleep from 11pm to 7am.

## Controls ð®
click the buttons to take care of Luda. Click the screen to switch camera angles. In the bottom left there's a reset button.

## Features ð¡
- A day night cycle based on real time
- Dialog feedback
- The instruments in the musical arrangement become more dissonant upon deprivation

---

# Development

## Missed Features ð
Some features that were planned but couldn't be made in time:
- More facial expressions for different interactions.
- Blinking of the eyes
I started very late and had only 15min left to spare in the end. This is not a lot of work but it's still too much to achieve in 15 minutes. Originally I also planned for Luda to take potty breaks but I scrapped that entirely.

## Tools Used ð 
Audio:
- Audacity
- Mulab

Development:
- Unity
- MonoDevelop

Other:
- Clip Studio Paint
- Cheetah 3D
- Screenflow (for the time lapse)

## Disclaimer â¼ï¸
The compo states one has to work alone but unfortunately I can not provide voice overs for female characters. I asked a friend to do the voice acting.

## Time Lapse ð°

items.name: Earth Last Defender
items.body:
Earth Last Defender is a game about keeping alive our beloved planet.

You are in charge of the last spaceship with a simple mission: protect Earth from the alien forces threatening our planet.

You start with a simple laser weapon, but scientists on Earth will aid you with some improvements, with extra fire rate or more weapons.

The alien forces are getting stronger, so it's just a matter of time that we lose all hope, but try to keep the planet alive for as long as you can!

You can try the game [here](https://eld.clotet.dev/)!

Some gameplay screenshots:

![1.png](///raw/0e3/d2/z/2c86f.png)

![2.png](///raw/0e3/d2/z/2c859.png)

![3.png](///raw/0e3/d2/z/2c844.png)

items.name: A Desperate Theif
items.body:
You're a good man in an unfortunate situation. You've been diagnosed with a mysterious illness and the only way to keep yourself alive is the raid experimental laboratories. Unbenounced to you, the facilities are guarded by high tech robots. Will you be able to find the medicine in time? Will you rack up enough cash to be able to compete with the facilities increasing defenses?

A Top down 2D rouge-like shooter. Big inspiration for me is the zelda games, hopefully you can see that in the very quickly put together map.

items.name: Innocuous Pong
items.body: It's a totally innocuous single player version of Pong! See if you can get to a score of 15 to see the ultimate level. Use your mouse to control.

items.name: EXTREME Garden Simulator
items.body:
Well. You are a simple man, with simple taste. You love your flower pots out in the sun. But it's hot. Like REALLY hot. So you have to constantly water your plants so they don't die. You gain points by keeping your plants alive and lose points by letting them die (not taking into account the emotional damage of seeing your plant buddies WILT IN THE SUN). Make sure to refill your watering can often so you don't run out of water.

Multiplayer Mode: (This mode is REALLY the most fun / heart of the game. It can even get quite tactical, but PLEASE don't let it end like the average game of "Mario Party"...)

Plants belong to the person who last watered it. This means they grant points to this player while alive, but also deduce points when dying. Try to score the most points by shoving and keeping the other player from watering and keeping your own plants alive.

Controls:

Player 1:
w, a, s, d / D-Pad / Left-Stick : Directional movement
space / a-button : Spill water from your watering can
left ctrl / b-button: shove the other player

Player 2:
up,down,left,right / D-Pad / Left-Stick : Directional movement
right ctrl / a-button : Spill water from your watering can
keypad 0 / b-button: shove the other player

Select stages by clicking on them. Return to menu by pressing Escape. Gamepad support is through SDL2. All major gamepads like 360 should work. My crappy age old ps1 ripoff controllers worked :-D .

This game was made with my very own handcrafted 2D Game Engine, called the [RawSalmonEngine](https://github.com/AgoutiGames/RawSalmonEngine). Web Build is brand new, hope it works everywhere. Gamepad support is probably missing on web build, what was to be expected.

items.name: Keep It Afloat
items.body:
You've taken the journey up on a flimsy DIY sky raft held up with a fire powered hot air balloon. Sadly, the local birds aren't too fond of this decision. Using your trusty green ball, send those fethered fiends back to the ground as to soar into the stratosphere!

A and D to move, (Left and Right on Controlers)
L to jump, K to attack, (Bottom and Left buttons)
W to aim up, S to drop through one way platforms, (Up and Down)
Escape to Pause, (Start)
Shift to lock yourself in place horizontally for better aiming, (L1 or R1)


How to Play:
Stand by the fire to keep the balloon in the air.

![Get Fire.gif](///raw/6a9/21/z/2c51a.gif)


Shoot the birds out of the sky

![Kill Birds.gif](///raw/6a9/21/z/2c59f.gif)


But if your health or fire runs out, get ready to plummet all the way down to the ground

![Death.gif](///raw/6a9/21/z/2c5f3.gif)


Note: The download version is for Windows only, so if you are on a Mac or Linux, please wait for a HTML 5 Version later.

items.name: Magic Atoth
items.body:
![SkÃ¤rmklipp2.JPG](///raw/4eb/72/z/2c7a4.jpg)

Ever wanted to take care of a pet, but never felt like it any of the pets out there was a perfect fit for you? Introducing Magic Atoth, the perfect breed of pet!

Geneticists here at the Atoth company have been hard at work researching and experimenting to figure out the formula for the ideal pet experience, and this cute little thing is the result of years of dedication towards the cause! Now, there's no need to choose between any of the thousands of other pets out there, just select the one that's made to be perfect!

But wait, there's more! While a regular pet may be a money-sucking machine, requiring specialized food, care and living standards, Magic Atoth eliminates the need to worry about money by being able to live in any condition! It can eat any type of food, including the stuff you don't want, and only needs water in addition with that in order to survive, and live happily! In fact, we don't even charge you money to get one, we're giving them away free to anyone who wants them!

There's just one requirement:

**Keep it alive.**

items.name: Life Alive
items.body:
An online multiplayer (no limit to players) 3D variant of [Conway's Game of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life), where human players control special cells that can move around the game of life board between the generations and influence the surrounding cells. The goal is to keep your cell alive for as many generations as possible. Despite having the magical ability to move around the board between the generations your cell is bound to the same rules as the other cells in the game; it will die if it is not alongside **exactly** two or three neighbouring cells when the next generation is computer.

To add to the challenge your cell has a finite amount of energy that can only be replenished by occupying a space with an energy bolt when the next generation is calculated, so you can't just sit around on a stable part of the board.

There is an additional option to have a bird's eye view of the board if you'd like to watch the magic unfold.

This is my first submission to Ludum Dare. I'm not an artist so I just used very basic primitives and tried to do my best. I wanted to do more with the audio but this was my first time using Tone.js and it was a bit of a learning curve for me.

The backend is a node.js server running on an Ubuntu server, but was developed on a Windows 10 PC using Visual Studio 2019. I started the code on the morning of Saturday, April 18th, 2020 and put the final version up on my server around 5:30pm CST on the 19th. I was considering submitting this as Compo but I did use Bootstrap and FontAwesome for the UI overlays which might disqualify me from Compo.

**NOTE** I am hosting the game on my own server [https://wip.digifi.ca:8869/](https://wip.digifi.ca:8869/) with a self-signed certificate so you'll likely get a security warning you'll have to go through to play.

items.body:

Start as a tiny flame and consume logs to get bigger. Avoid cold and water, otherwise you're going to have to start over while your fire source gets weaker. Share the gathered flame with the bonfire to keep it burning. 

What are you waiting for? Go ahead and prove that you're on fire!

items.name: The Three Sisters
items.body:
After the bombs fell, the world got colder. Colder, windier, and a lot more dangerous. There are bandits, gangs and desperate loners who all need food, clothes and shelter to survive. Guns and ammo are hard to come by, but blunt and sharp weapons are fairly easy to find. 

The outcast is not good. People have gathered in commune shelters, trying to restart some kind of society, but most of them have since been raided or just started in-fighting which quickly escalated to mass murder.

You are the leader of a small band of people, all scared and desperate. One of your good friends, may he rest in piece, shared a secret with you before he passed: somewhere in the "Three Sisters" mountains, there is a hidden commune which has both food and shelter. As a last resort, you have set out for this commune, and you now stand before the "Three Sisters".

<hr>

The Three Sisters is an interactive novel where you have to keep your party alive and find shelter in the mountains. Made with twinery.org in 24h.

items.name: The Light Child
items.body:
So this was my first foray into game jams and LD, and I have to say it was an absolute blast! It's been quite a while since I've last developed any games, so it's fun to be getting back into it. 

My game is called "The Light Child". The main goal of the game is to keep the small fire creature alive (by feeding it wood and protecting it from enemies), all the while also collecting four orbs so that you can rid the world of the darkness it finds itself in. The game is definitely on the harder side, but if you're up for a challenge, then this game is for you!

Controls:
- Move with arrow keys
- Pickup/drop items with space bar
- 'z' to attack with the axe, or to feed the fire child wood pieces
- esc to pause

The game was made using Godot and all art was made in Aseprite (both of which I only starting learning on Friday :sweat_smile:). Unfortunately, I didn't get around to adding any music :(

I look forwards to participating in future Ludum Dares, and hope you all have fun playing my game!

items.name: Take Care Luda
items.body:
# Game General
## Description ð
You take care of Luda and her essential needs. If she wants something or she feels like she's had enough, she'll let you know. If you leave her alone for a while, she will not take care of herself. What a lazy bum! Everyone needs sleep and that includes Luda. She's asleep from 11pm to 7am.

## Controls ð®
click the buttons to take care of Luda. Click the screen to switch camera angles. In the bottom left there's a reset button.

## Features ð¡
- A day night cycle based on real time
- Dialog feedback
- The instruments in the musical arrangement become more dissonant upon deprivation

---

# Development

## Missed Features ð
Some features that were planned but couldn't be made in time:
- More facial expressions for different interactions.
- Blinking of the eyes
I started very late and had only 15min left to spare in the end. This is not a lot of work but it's still too much to achieve in 15 minutes. Originally I also planned for Luda to take potty breaks but I scrapped that entirely.

## Tools Used ð 
Audio:
- Audacity
- Mulab

Development:
- Unity
- MonoDevelop

Other:
- Clip Studio Paint
- Cheetah 3D
- Screenflow (for the time lapse)

## Disclaimer â¼ï¸
The compo states one has to work alone but unfortunately I can not provide voice overs for female characters. I asked a friend to do the voice acting.

## Time Lapse ð°

items.name: Magic Atoth
items.body:
![SkÃ¤rmklipp2.JPG](///raw/4eb/72/z/2c7a4.jpg)

Ever wanted to take care of a pet, but never felt like it any of the pets out there was a perfect fit for you? Introducing Magic Atoth, the perfect breed of pet!

Geneticists here at the Atoth company have been hard at work researching and experimenting to figure out the formula for the ideal pet experience, and this cute little thing is the result of years of dedication towards the cause! Now, there's no need to choose between any of the thousands of other pets out there, just select the one that's made to be perfect!

But wait, there's more! While a regular pet may be a money-sucking machine, requiring specialized food, care and living standards, Magic Atoth eliminates the need to worry about money by being able to live in any condition! It can eat any type of food, including the stuff you don't want, and only needs water in addition with that in order to survive, and live happily! In fact, we don't even charge you money to get one, we're giving them away free to anyone who wants them!

There's just one requirement:

**Keep it alive.**

items.name: Life Alive
items.body:
An online multiplayer (no limit to players) 3D variant of [Conway's Game of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life), where human players control special cells that can move around the game of life board between the generations and influence the surrounding cells. The goal is to keep your cell alive for as many generations as possible. Despite having the magical ability to move around the board between the generations your cell is bound to the same rules as the other cells in the game; it will die if it is not alongside **exactly** two or three neighbouring cells when the next generation is computer.

To add to the challenge your cell has a finite amount of energy that can only be replenished by occupying a space with an energy bolt when the next generation is calculated, so you can't just sit around on a stable part of the board.

There is an additional option to have a bird's eye view of the board if you'd like to watch the magic unfold.

This is my first submission to Ludum Dare. I'm not an artist so I just used very basic primitives and tried to do my best. I wanted to do more with the audio but this was my first time using Tone.js and it was a bit of a learning curve for me.

The backend is a node.js server running on an Ubuntu server, but was developed on a Windows 10 PC using Visual Studio 2019. I started the code on the morning of Saturday, April 18th, 2020 and put the final version up on my server around 5:30pm CST on the 19th. I was considering submitting this as Compo but I did use Bootstrap and FontAwesome for the UI overlays which might disqualify me from Compo.

**NOTE** I am hosting the game on my own server [https://wip.digifi.ca:8869/](https://wip.digifi.ca:8869/) with a self-signed certificate so you'll likely get a security warning you'll have to go through to play.

items.name: The Three Sisters
items.body:
After the bombs fell, the world got colder. Colder, windier, and a lot more dangerous. There are bandits, gangs and desperate loners who all need food, clothes and shelter to survive. Guns and ammo are hard to come by, but blunt and sharp weapons are fairly easy to find. 

The outcast is not good. People have gathered in commune shelters, trying to restart some kind of society, but most of them have since been raided or just started in-fighting which quickly escalated to mass murder.

You are the leader of a small band of people, all scared and desperate. One of your good friends, may he rest in piece, shared a secret with you before he passed: somewhere in the "Three Sisters" mountains, there is a hidden commune which has both food and shelter. As a last resort, you have set out for this commune, and you now stand before the "Three Sisters".

<hr>

The Three Sisters is an interactive novel where you have to keep your party alive and find shelter in the mountains. Made with twinery.org in 24h.

## The Game
Sitbot 5000 is the 5000th iteration of a bot made for sitting.  Sitting Babies, that is!

Use your powers of movement and action to ensure no unfortunate accidents befall the little tyke.

## The Controls
WASD, Arrow Keys, or Controller D-pad: Move

Spacebar, Enter, or Controller A button: Action

Escape or Controller Select: Back to Title

## The Experience
I wish I'd had a chance to build a few more levels, but I guess that's the nature of the Compo.  This is my first solo, and I'm glad I was able to get something actually completed.

Good luck everyone!

items.name: Valley of the Dying
items.body:
You have just fended off marauders from destroying your village, but just barely. Those you love are seriously injured and to save them, you must travel through the Valley of the Dying with an ancient treant named Genesis. As you trek though the Valley, you'll fight off hordes of beasts so you can reach the Holy Well. When Genesis drinks from the Well, it produces a single Magic Fruit which can be used to heal an ally. 

Battle back and forth between your village and the Holy Well until the entire team is back on their feet. If Genesis dies, the game is over.

items.name: Nurturer
items.body:
ââHow to play:â
The goal of the game is to plant trees and there is no real end condition. The world blossom's health deteriorates as its protector golem expends energy to create life in a newly forming world.

Controls:
E to deposit energy
WASD to move
Scroll wheel or keyboard 1-3 to select an object
Click to place a structure (on an indicator)

âObjects:

Energy:

âPicked up by walking into, you can bring energy to the world blossom or connected trees to the world blossom. Press E to deposit energy. Energy can also be generated by plants.

Trees: 
Trees make connections to the world blossom, which act as additional deposit zones for energy. Additionally, the golem can move efficiently between connections to the world blossom, so the world blossom's health does not decrease on these tiles.
Plants:

Plants are an expensive structure that generate 1 energy over the course of almost 1 difficulty stage. To produce energy, they must have a free space in one of the four cardinal directions.
Rocks: 
Rocks obstruct pathing, as well as connections between trees. They don't have any function at this time, but were planned to be used to trap enemies.

items.name: SoapBoy
items.body:
With no one else to turn to, the General reaches out..
..to our only hope..

..Soapboy!

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/2f6/21/z/2c62b.png)

-Controls Keyboard-


1 - Shoot

Space - Jump

Arrows - Move


-Controls XBox-


X - Shoot

A - Jump

Directional Pad - Move


-Controls PS-



Square - Shoot

X - Jump

Directional Pad - Move



-Issues that I am aware of-
If there are any flickering going on in full screen, I am unaware on how to fix this,
and it seems to be a Pixel Game Maker MV issue


My take on the theme was to make light of our current situation,
so I made a game where you play as Soapboy and fight zombies and
evil bacteria!



Made in Pixel Game Maker MV using the base engine tools, so sorry no source code beyond engine!



Obviously with the 48 hours I couldn't quite fit everything I wanted
in the game, however I did the best I could, and hope you enjoy it all the same.

Depending on skill, I'd say it takes about 5-10 minutes to complete what is 
essentially a level 1!

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/2f6/21/z/2c62f.png)

Blog series / link to play the game: https://blog.jverkamp.com/2020/04/19/ld46-tetris-life-v1.0/



Controls:

* Left and right to move the block and forth
* Z and X to rotate it (or crash into things)
* If a block gets stuck, you can hit ENTER to lock it in place
* ESC to quit the current level

Goals:

* To win: Get the plants to the top of the level
* To lose: Kill off all of the plants #keepitalive

Quill18 suggested making any game, even ping pong and slapping the theme on it. Well I somehow made a game that I'm not embarrassed to call a game - Sandy Road. Your goal is to survive as long as possible, or at least until you get bored. To score shoot the drivers. Made in Unity.

Left mouse button to aim.

Right mouse button to shoot.

items.name: Partners
items.body:
![cover.png](///raw/abb/1/z/2c715.png)
# Story
Your friend has fallen ill, collect food while fighting off zombies. But you need to be quick your friend won't last long. Return with enough food (and often) to save your friend.

# Controls
**A** and **D** to move left and right  
**Space** to jump  
**Left Click**/**Left Control** to shoot  
**F** to melee  
**E** to interact  
**C** to eat to recover health

I liked this concept of having to take care of someone and not really have an idea of how well they are doing when you are out. I felt like while playing it gave a sense of urgency and fear that you could come home and find your friend dead. If I had more time I would like to have put in some more metroidvania aspects, like puzzles and power ups that would unlock new areas. I think it could work well as a full game (with much better balancing).

Thank you for playing!

items.name: Keep Your Egg Alive
items.body:
Here a prototype of a virtual companion for you to keep along with you on your PC.

An Egg which need a little bit of attention to be kept alive. 

Nothing big just timely Feed it. Don't over feed it. Notice and be careful of its likes and dislikes. Keep it entertained so it doesn't  get bored. 

It doesn't require you attention all the time. Just start it, and get on with your other works.  Just keep a little bit of eye on it, so it doesn't die.


p.s. This was my individual submission, but we are making an another group submission tomorrow . Look forward for it.

items.name: Shadows of Drakthur
items.body:
Game made for ludum dare 46 using Unity, Affinity Designer, sfxr, and Song Maker.

The theme was to keep it alive, so you are in charge of the defenses of your space station on its way to Eden. Spend your resources wisely to repair and add cannons to the hull of the ship.   

This is a very quick piece after taking a few years off of game development. I had a lot of fun with this one for sure. I took inspiration from the first boss in Contra (NES) wondering what it would be like to play the defense wall rather than the players. I had stretch goals of adding more sound effects, multiple turrets, power cores to shield tiles, and a chatty AI that runs the station, but had to scale these items back to make the deadline. 



Simply click and build and make your way to the Eden Outpost where you and your crew will be safe!



Thanks for check out my game.

Matt![Shadows_Cover.png](///raw/2ce/z/2c639.png)

items.body:

You have been warned! this game is very hard...

I am slightly happy with the outcome, the sounds are REALLY bad, and the art is forced and simple. Next time I need to scale down my scope as much as possible. a little too hopeful(typical of LD)

I hope you have some fun for what it is, I wish everyone the best of luck and have fun rating games.

PS: I DON'T KNOW WHAT HAPPENED BUT I CANNOT BUILD TO HTML IN UNITY SO A WINDOWS EXE IS ALL I GOT - I AM SO SORRY ABOUT THAT!

WASD to move

Left Mouse to shoot

Find all the keys in the dungeon and escape with your life (and the Knights life too i guess...)

If you die, you lose. If the knight dies, you lose. Keep it alive!

Thanks for playing, I hope everyone had a great ludum dare 46!

## The Game
Sitbot 5000 is the 5000th iteration of a bot made for sitting.  Sitting Babies, that is!

Use your powers of movement and action to ensure no unfortunate accidents befall the little tyke.

## The Controls
WASD, Arrow Keys, or Controller D-pad: Move

## The Experience
I wish I'd had a chance to build a few more levels, but I guess that's the nature of the Compo.  This is my first solo, and I'm glad I was able to get something actually completed.

Good luck everyone!

Cooking in a summer camp is hell! Beware of kids allergies and requests. **Keep them all alive!**

A game by **Pierre Tremblay-ThÃ©riault**

[iampierre.ca](http://jesuispierre.ca/)

[lapinchatware.ca](http://lapinchatware.ca/)

# Controls
* Click on ingredients to add them
* Click on the bell to serve

## Goals
* Cook soup for your kids
* Watchout for allergies !!!! (Skip adding an ingredient if the kid is allergic.)
* Add everything else the kids wants.

## Do not
* Add more ingredients
* Add to few ingredients
* Add ingredient appearing on the allergy list

items.name: Turbine Troubles
items.body:
# Welcome to the Future!

Society thrives thanks to nearly unlimited power generated by **GIANT TURBINES** in the sky... Turbines **DEGRADE** over time. It's your job to keep them **WORKING.**  Use the **Robo-Launcher 2034** and see how long you can keep the turbines **ALIVE**!

![Title.PNG](///raw/03a/d/z/2c233.png)

---

## Downloads and Links:
* WebGL: https://fussenkuh.itch.io/turbine-troubles
* Source: Available to download at the WebGL link

---

---

## Developer Notes:

Overall, I'm happy with what I've accomplished. I learned some new (to me) Unity techniques and brought a new game into the world... all in the span of 48 hours. I'd call that a win! I'm looking forward to checking out everyone's submissions :)

I didn't have the full weekend to dedicate to The Jam. Considering the time constraints, I wanted to keep the game's scope small. Needless to say, the actual code leaves a bit to be desired. 24 hours means it's time to throw out my software engineering best practices and just start hacking.

When played on the Web, I've noticed that, on occasion, the background music doesn't always start playing and the audio, in general, tends to pop. If you experience music drop-out, try reloading the web page and/or pressing the [ESC] key to reload the game.



---

## Tools:

* Unity 2019.2
* Inkscape
* Audacity
* '98 Fender Toronado
* The Google Machine

---

items.name: Human Apocalypse
Chicken Little
items.body:
Keep the chickens alive by clicking on the falling apples to prevent them from falling on the chicken's head.Â  If an apple hits a chicken, then it is knocked out.Â  Additional chickens are awarded after clicking a number of apples.Â  Once all of the chickens are knocked out, the game is over.Â  Enter your name to store it in the online leaderboard, which tracks who has the longest survival time.

Each level has three waves.Â  After each level, at random either the gravity is increased or an additional apple drops during each wave.

![chicken-little_00004.jpg](///raw/9a1/z/2c563.jpg)

![chicken-little_00005.jpg](///raw/9a1/z/2c56e.jpg)

![chicken-little_00002.jpg](///raw/9a1/z/2c571.jpg)


Previous Code - https://github.com/gatechgrad/LeaderboardExample

I used my LeaderboardExample code for submitting the high score values to my database.  The game simply makes URL calls to the PHP files on my server to submit and query the scores.  The PHP and MySQL database code are also included in the examples.

items.name: MACHINA
items.body:
![cover_fhd_white_4.png](///raw/2de/2/z/2c686.png)

## DESCRIPTION
**MACHINA** is a turn-based tactical game that incorporates random elements in both the environments and the available actions. You take control of an A.I. that is aiding a human through multiple levels and is making sure they stay alive for their ultimate goals.

## LINKS

**Game and source code**: https://halisavakis.itch.io/machina

## CONTROLS

- Left click to select
- Right click to rotate skill pattern
- A/D or Left/Right to rotate camera around the environment

The controls are thoroughly explained in the first dialogue segment of the game.

## SCREENSHOTS

![screen_1920x1080_2020-04-20_03-08-21.png](///raw/2de/2/z/2c4e5.png)
![screen_1920x1080_2020-04-20_03-09-30.png](///raw/2de/2/z/2c4ef.png)
![screen_1920x1080_2020-04-20_03-10-12.png](///raw/2de/2/z/2c4f4.png)
![screen_1920x1080_2020-04-20_03-10-44.png](///raw/2de/2/z/2c4f7.png)

## CREDITS

- Art/Coding/Music: [Harry Alisavakis](https://twitter.com/HarryAlisavakis)
- Attributions for SFX audio files which have been heavily modified and used in the project:
  - https://freesound.org/people/GeronimoGeronimo/sounds/338067/
  - https://freesound.org/people/humanoide9000/sounds/422440/
  - https://freesound.org/people/Speedenza/sounds/318560/

## NOTES

- There are known bugs especially with the level generation as it is pretty random and does not ensure paths will always be there.
- The game is pretty unbalanced and therefore can be pretty hard, but I think it's worth it to try and make it to the end. There's only 3 levels with 3 waves each.
- This is obviously not a complete thing on its own but it serves as a proof of concept for a type of game like this.

items.name: Square Loves Circle!
items.body:
Square loves Circle - and when you love something, what do you do? You keep it alive!

A simple and sweet platforming game where your (the square's) objective is to make sure that the circle makes it to safety and doesn't fall into any endless holes or anything like that.

Controls: Arrow keys or WASD.
Space/Up/W for jump.
R to restart a level.
You may need to click on the canvas to see anything. You might also find it more enjoyable to put your browser in full screen mode.

This runs on WebAssembly - if you have a modern browser (i.e. not I.E.) it should just run. It may take a bit to load all of the assets, but after it finishes loading, it will run entirely locally. It might take a few seconds for anything to happen - do not lose hope too fast if all you see if a empty screen!

items.name: Undead Car
items.body:
Keep your car's engine alive so you can escape zombies!

## Controls
- WASD moves your character on the screen
- Mouse aims the gun
- Left click shoots the shotgun
- Pressing E next to the car makes the player jump in or out of the car
- Pressing F uses a gas canister on the car's tank. Even if it's full!
- Esc to quit on windows

## Goal
You need to get away from the incoming wave of the zombies.
Small hordes of zombies probably can't kill you, but be careful.
Keep an eye on the zombie radar, you'll die instantly if they get
to you!

There's an abandoned car close to your shack. It might still turn
on once. If it runs out of gas, it probably doesn't start up again.
Keep that engine alive!

You can carry at most three canisters of gas along with you. Make
sure the car doesn't run out while idling!

**Disclaimer** It's going to take multiple tries, but it's a short one!

![UndeadCarTitle.jpg](///raw/da/z/2c5cf.jpg)
![UndeadCarSS.jpg](///raw/da/z/2c604.jpg)

items.name: Lost Beneath
items.body: Platforming game

items.name: Colony
items.body:
In this game you create your own ant colony by digging tunnels and constructing rooms. But you won't do this all by yourself of course, as the queen you'll acquire servants to do the work for you!

Your goal is to stockpile food for the winter and fend off any threats coming your way. Protect the queen at all cost!

# Controls

* __Moving the Camera__ use the arrow keys or right mouse button 

* __Creating ants__ use the "actions" menu in the bottom left corner _only works if you have any eggs available_

* __Building rooms__ use the "build" menu in the bottom right corner, click to confirm

# Score

* You'll gain 1 point for each second that the colony survives.

* Each collected food item grants 30 points.

# Types of ants

* __Queen__ the most important of them all. You'll lose the game if she dies. She can lay eggs by using the "lay eggs" action in the action menu (_if there's one or more empty nurseries available_).
![QueenAnt.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c307.png)

Harvey Rideswell wants a puppy, but his parents don't think that he's responsible enough to care for one, so he was given a plant for a trial run. Harvey must care for this plant, if he wants his own puppy.

items.name: Keep her alive!
items.body:
In keep her alive you are on a journey with your wife. Unfortunately she has developed an illness on the journey and is resting to recouperate, at the end of each day you make a journey to the shop along the hazardous path to get supplies for your sick wife, the shopkeepers may also have an upgrade or two for yourself if you have the funds!

Developed using the below tools:

Godot 3.2

BFXR

Pixaki 

Photoshop

Abundant Music

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls

WASD - Move

Mouse Cursor - Move sword

Left Click - Swing sword


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MACOS AND LINUX Builds are untested.


![home.png](///raw/9b4/c2/z/2c5ac.png)


![Annotation 2020-04-20 012050.png](///raw/9b4/c2/z/2c5ad.png)


![ogre.png](///raw/9b4/c2/z/2c5ae.png)



My first publically available game and honestly, not that great! But it's out there.
Really wanted to explore the relationship between the player character and the wife but sadly ran out of time.


Some thoughts at the finish line

I started with the wrong node type for enemies and it was too late in the compo to change so if enemies get "air" beneath them they will fall very slowly, it's a bug, no time to fix it before end of compo.
Sound effects are garbage and would dedicate time to a proper folly job next time
I'm not an artist but boy is there some real programmer art in there 
Overall though, that's a project done in 48 hours. I'm proud of myself. I'm impressed with everyones work here. Well done all!

Let me know what you think below. Thank you.

items.name: Frost & Fire
items.body:
Deep in the caves Khu's people have lived for thousands of their short generations, ravaged by radiation from the nearby quasar.

There were legends of a surviving ship far away beyond the rock walls that will carry them to a world of green, far from frost and fire.

items.name: Type it alive
items.body:
## How
Everything done in plain javascript  
Atom for coding  
Paint and Piskel for drawing  
Had not time for music :(  

## Controls
Move with arrows  
Build with space  
Type the letters above the buildings (in order)  

## How to play
Every building has its own propierties:  
**White:** standard  
**Green:** low damage, stuns enemies  
**Yellow:** splash damage  
**Magenta:** big damage, high cooldown  
  
Let a building "die" and it will halve it's level  

Damage and stun scales with level (level 3 does x3 damage, level 5 does x3 damage and so on)

Try to beat all 15 levels, it's a bit hard but i'ts possible :D

items.name: Nature's Balance
items.body:
![Gameplay LaterMid.PNG](///raw/e83/f2/z/2c500.png)Welcome to Nature's Balance!  You are given a plot of empty land and a little bit of money, and your job is to build up a forest.  Use the money you are given to place plants and animals, earning more money with each living thing in your forest.  But be careful: will the rabbit you just added reproduce out of control and wipe out your vegetation, or will the wolves hunt them to extinction?  Can you keep your forest growing, and more importantly, can you keep it alive?

This is my first ever game jam submission.  I have been teaching myself to code as a hobby for the past two years or so, and while I am certainly no artist or game designer, I'm excited to have completed a project and get your feedback!

Created Using:
Unity Engine 2019.3.0f6
Photoshop
Reaper w/ Native Instruments

items.name: Love Is Alive: A Couples Therapist Keeps Love Alive
items.body:
First, a .gif to start off things...
![lia-short.gif](///raw/e9d/c2/z/2c6ec.gif)

In the midst of shelter-in-home, I've been watching a reality show called _Love is Blind_ like many other consumers.
In addition to that, I've been watching "Couples Therapist Reacts to Love is Blind" on YouTube and it's been surprisingly insightful! [link here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRot2oCPvjI) 

Having been shut in with my spouse for over a month now, I am increasingly thankful for vulnerable moments, and aware of walls that we put up when we are unhappy.

This game is a playful take on what I guess some couples therapists do in their job -- sort through anger, defenses, and find the true emotions and make sure there's two way communication.

In addition, I just wanted to experiment with procedurally generated maps, so that's what this ended up being. Just a one screen game about a couples therapy session. 

I didn't have too much time to polish up the letters, so you might find it not perfect -- but if you had watched _Love Is Blind_, I think you might recognize some of the sentiments!

A longer gif:

![lia.gif](///raw/e9d/c2/z/2c708.gif)

More screenshots:

![2020-04-19 17_22_22-LD46 - main - WebGL - Unity 2019.2.10f1 Personal [PREVIEW PACKAGES IN USE] _DX11.png](///raw/e9d/c2/z/2c590.png)

![2020-04-19 17_22_53-LD46 - main - WebGL - Unity 2019.2.10f1 Personal [PREVIEW PACKAGES IN USE] _DX11.png](///raw/e9d/c2/z/2c593.png)

items.name: Alive.io
items.body:
This is my first Ludum Dare and first solo game in more than 1 year. Hope you will enjoy playing it as much as I enjoyed making it. I missed making games so much!

![title.png](///raw/a8a/f2/z/2c719.png)

## Intro
Once upon a time there were some clans

God of Death wants them to fight and die. Self destruction is the nature anyway.

You, God of Life, want to keep them ALIVE!

But for how long?

## How to play?
*Rules:*
- You indirectly control the clans' behavior by placing food
- Try to keep them from killing each other as long as you can
- Or don't, just watch them fight!

*Controls:*
- Left click to spawn food
- Use mouse wheel to zoom the camera in and out
- Right click and drag to rotate the camera view
- There is useful info in HUD, you can also check the box "abundant food" to auto-generate, well, abundant, food.

## Screenshots
The static images of this game is far far less interesting than the actual game!

![Screenshot (44).png](///raw/a8a/f2/z/2c721.png)
^ 3 little clans

![Screenshot (67).png](///raw/a8a/f2/z/2c6fe.png)
^ Clans running for food

## Known bugs
- If you look straight down from above, camera would glitch.

## P.S.
I really can't compose by myself so this game has no music. Enjoy the visual though!

## P.S. #2
Why is it called alive.io? A friend spotted that the colors I used in this game is very similar to those used in io games, and the mechanic of factions fight each other is similar too! So why not just name it io :p :stuck_out_tongue: 

## Credits
- [bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/) was used for generating sound effects for this game.

items.name: Colony
items.body:
In this game you create your own ant colony by digging tunnels and constructing rooms. But you won't do this all by yourself of course, as the queen you'll acquire servants to do the work for you!

Your goal is to stockpile food for the winter and fend off any threats coming your way. Protect the queen at all cost!

# Controls

* __Moving the Camera__ use the arrow keys or right mouse button 

* __Creating ants__ use the "actions" menu in the bottom left corner _only works if you have any eggs available_

* __Building rooms__ use the "build" menu in the bottom right corner, click to confirm

# Score

* You'll gain 1 point for each second that the colony survives.

* Each collected food item grants 30 points.

# Types of ants

* __Queen__ the most important of them all. You'll lose the game if she dies. She can lay eggs by using the "lay eggs" action in the action menu (_if there's one or more empty nurseries available_).
![QueenAnt.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c307.png)

* __Soldier__ wanders around the hive. Has increased health and damage. Useful for fending off attackers.
![SoldierAnt.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c2f2.png)

* __Forager__ digs tunnels under the surface and searches for food. When food is found it will be caried to a storage room if there is one available.
![ForagerAnt.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c309.png)

* __Builder__ digs tunnels and constructs rooms. You'll need at least 1 builder to construct rooms.
![BuilderAnt.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c30b.png)

# Rooms

* __Nursery__ houses eggs, which can be laid by the queen. You'll need at least 1 nursery to lay eggs.
![NurseryRoom.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c31d.png)

* __Queen Room__ houses the queen. The queen will return here after laying eggs.
![QueensRoom.png](///raw/f75/c/z/2c31f.png)

* __Storage__ drop off point for foragers. Each stored food grants 30 points.

items.name: LifeShip
items.body:
You and your crew are stranded in a "LifeShip" after a catastrophic accident of the main ship. You must navigate star systems and collect essential resources to keep your crew alive. You have a very limited supply of fuel, oxygen, and food. Jump between systems and land on planets and rings to collect resources. Different planets yield different resources (fuel, oxygen, food) and some are more abundant than others. Eventually, safely reach a space station and bring your ship to safety. 

Each system is randomly generated, and planet surfaces are randomly generated. Use arrow keys to move ship and player around.

Written in Golang using Ebiten. I tried to get a WebGL version but the planetary generation does not work nice in a browser :(. I have versions for Windows and MacOS. Ultimately this was fun because Ebiten is such a simple game library, and I ended up spending a lot of time writing my own viewports, collisions and scene system on top of building the game. It could definitely use some more polish but I'm still proud of what I did in 48 hours. 

Demo:
![demo.gif](///raw/088/81/z/2c595.gif)

items.body:

It is your task to keep the blob alive, hopefully we will find a permanent solution soon.

The game uses the excellent FastNoise library by Jordan Peck: https://github.com/Auburns/FastNoise_CSharp

items.name: Coronary Flypass
items.body:
Greetings, Drone Operator!

There's a patient on the other side of the city who needs a heart transplant, and yours is the only drone available to bring it to them. I trust you won't let anything get in your way. And for god's sake, don't drop the heart.

Guide the drone and heart through 7 action filled levels, but don't delay, because the heart cannot survive long outside a sterile refrigeration unit, so you'll need to be quick if you want it to still be beating when you arrive. Also, don't drop it. 

WASD or arrows to fly the drone. R to restart a level. 

![screenshot1.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/2c539.png)
![screenshot2.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/2c53b.png)
![screenshot3.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/2c53f.png)

Tools used:

- Code: Godot
- Art: Aseprite, paint.net
- Audio: Bosca Ceoil, sfxr, Audacity, MyChord, AutoChord
- Font: Komika Axis


Mac and Linux builds, while available, are sadly untested. They should work though.

items.name: Supermarket Showdown
items.body:
### Supermarket Showdown

The shelves are empty. The people aren't happy.
They're coming for you - the store manager.

Thankfully, you're in a supermarket! Using the last of the stock, you can build defences to protect yourself from the hoards of angry customers. For how many business days can you keep yourself alive?

A retro-style tower defence game, where you protect yourself from bunches of angry customers in the supermarket.

### Gameplay

All you need is a mouse!

A bunch of customers will come to attempt to siege the supermarket each day. The hoards get bigger each day, so you need to buy and build items from the catalogue to help defend yourself.

Hover over the items in the catalogue to find out more about them, and click them to purchase them.
The green spots will tell you where you can place your defences - click on them to place your item!
After placing a defence there is a cool-down period before you can place it again.

You get payed by the hour, and each morning you get a daily bonus of extra cash and an increased wage!

You can also use perks to increase the effectiveness of your turrets, but these only last for the duration of the day you bought them on.

### Images
![thumbnail.png](///raw/6a6/e1/z/2c328.png)
![screenshot.png](///raw/6a6/e1/z/2c4db.png)

### What I used to make it

Programmed in Python using Pygame.
All art was drawn in GIMP.
Music was created using Beepbox (https://beepbox.co/).
Sound effects generated in the fabulous SFXR (http://drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html).

items.name: Shifty Maze
items.body:
![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/622/9/z/2c588.gif)
Sneakily place and remove walls in a maze to keep the wandering souls hopelessly lost. Their fear feeds the maze. The maze isn't happy with simply trapping souls. You need to keep openings available to give the victims hope.



Controls: Mouse only

Post-jam notes:
- I think this came out pretty funny. The further you get, the more out of control everything becomes.
- I think it could be a neat idea, but my execution here could have been a lot better.
- I would have liked to have saved some time with the AI by just keeping it simple. It didn't end up working as well I'd have liked.
- Biggest missed feature I think would be something to make it clearer where you can and can't place walls. It's pretty difficult going in blind if you're having trouble working why you can't click in many places.
- I missed out on audio, but given my busy life-schedule, I don't think I'd have time anyway. It kind of works without audio, but I would have liked more juice and polish.
- The 3rd upgrade is broken, ignore it.


All criticism is welcomed.

items.name: The Center
items.body:
The Center is a top-down action game where you can salvage robotic parts from enemies and install them in yourself after killing them. These parts include weapons, cameras, CPUs, movement systems, power supplies, etc. Certain weapons, for example, shotguns, rocket launchers, and chainsaws, break individual parts, which means that it is more difficult to salvage new equipment from the enemies you kill. Other weapons, such as tasers and lightning guns, can disable enemies without damaging their parts, guaranteeing that all of their parts will be fully intact and ready for you to salvage.

If you ever see an enemy that has an extremely powerful weapon or is capable of moving at extreme speeds, it is *always possible* to kill it and steal its weapon or movement system. *Every single weapon, movement system, or type of vision in the game is available for the player to use,* as long as you can kill the enemy.

If an enemy damages one of your parts while you're using it or you take a broken part from an enemy, you can still use that part, but it will have major penalties.

*Weapons* - Broken weapons will fire at half the rate and will be less accurate.

*Movement* - Broken movement systems cause you to move at half the speed that they would normally allow.

*Camera* - A broken camera will periodically suddenly move, making aiming harder.

*CPU* - CPUs kill you if you have one that has been broken for 10 seconds.

*Power* - Power supplies kill you if you have one that has been broken for a full minute.

![shoot.png](///raw/370/02/z/2ba2d.png)

## Controls

WASD to move

Left click to shoot in the direction of the mouse

Scroll wheel or F to switch between your primary and secondary weapons

E to interact with dead enemies, as long as you are standing on top of them

## Menu

![menu.png](///raw/370/02/z/2ba4b.png)

To swap one of your components with the enemy's corresponding component, click it. To see the description for a part, hover over it, and its description will appear in the bottom left box. Broken parts will be colored bright red. Broken CPUs and power supplies will fade from white to red, and when they are red, it means that they are completely broken and will kill anything that they are placed in.

items.name: Karmagotchi - A virtual friend
items.body:
**Karmagotchi** is about taking care of your little virtual friend.

Use the little arrow in the upper left corner to show and hide the menu.

The goal of the game is to keep your little buddy alive without them getting into too much trouble. 

They will often get dirty and will need cleaning. If they max out their needs in any way they can lose health. Health cannot be regained. If your buddy eats too much, they will become overweight and lose health. 

Play with them to exercise and lose that weight. If they become too dirty they will become sick and will need medication.

A pill can be bought with enough gold.
You can acquire gold by digging their poop away. This will also lessen the chance of your buddy staying in it. Staying in poop will accelerate your hygiene levels.

I recommend downloading it, if you can. It looks better and plays better. It also has a much bigger screensize.

items.name: MMO Raid Healer Simulator
items.body:
The simulation experience of what it's like to be a healer in an MMO Raid!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wZhdUXI0Wyg

## Abilities

1. **"Cure": Simple**, spammable heal
2. **"Healing Aura"**: Simple, spammable, AoE heal
3. **"Herbal Infusion"**: Charge for a few seconds then heal large heal
4. **"Innervate"**: Channeled over-time heal
5. **"Shrooooooms!"**: Charge for a few seconds and heal your entire team.
6. **"Revive"**: Single-target revive.


Your allies will use a combination of channelled and charged abilities to deal damage to the boss.

## The Kraken

The Kraken uses a single-target ability on-cooldown, with every 3-4 attacks being an AoE ability that deals damage to everyone on your team.

items.name: Hacking is Probably Not Like This
items.body:
![ld.gif](///raw/173/6/z/2c4b8.gif)
_**Hacking is Probably Not Like This**_ is a game that is (supposedly) about hacking.

And how do we hack? **Puzzle games**!

![ld5.png](///raw/173/6/z/2c2fd.png)

In the futuristic year of **20XX**, you take on the role of a **talented hacker**, **falsely accused** of a laundry list of crimes by the state, and set to be **imprisoned in 30 days**.

![ld7.png](///raw/173/6/z/2c2f8.png)

An unknown benefactor reaches out to you and offers you a **deal** - **help them hack** the secrets out of the world's biggest and most infamous corporations, and they'll help **get you your freedom**.

![ld4.png](///raw/173/6/z/2c2fa.png)

But you have to stay sharp - **keeping the machine you use running alive** takes lots of **energy** (electro-juice, natch), earned from successful hacks. Fail too many times and, well, it's lights out.

![ld6.png](///raw/173/6/z/2c301.png)

**Hacking is Probably Not Like This** contains **at least 11 puzzle games** (and **less than 13**) for you to enjoy, and lets you live out the dream of enacting **10 kinds of justice** to a **randomly generated list of over a hundred corporations**.

It is playable both on the **web** (in HTML5) and **Windows**, and you can find the **links at the bottom of this page**.

![ld8.png](///raw/173/6/z/2c2f4.png)

_**Hacking**_ was developed solely by myself in Godot over 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 46 Compo (Keep it Alive). 

It is controlled with the arrow keys to move, and the Z key to select (with P to pause), and features autosave capability. It also features background imagery taken from my room, my desk full of anime stuff, and a nearby river which normally looks real nice, but currently is kind of brown.

There is no sound (sorry!), but feel free to put on your best lo-fi beats to hack/cyberpunk to. The font used for the game is [Inconsolata](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Inconsolata).

_**Hacking**_ is my second release under the label **300g curry lab**, a sub-label of my indie game circle **[300g curry rice](http://300g.megane-moe.com/)**. We make all sorts of indie games celebrating mixes of anime homage and nostalgic game remake, and I'd be plenty pleased to have you either follow [my circle](https://twitter.com/300g_curry_rice) or [myself](http://canon.megane-moe.com) (invelica - previously sayumeki) on Twitter.

Thanks for your time! Happy hacking!

items.name: Bargaining with Supreme Beings So They Don't Destroy Us All
items.body:
About
-----
The Supreme Beings demand offerings to avoid everything from being destroyed. They're fussy about them as well, and demand a specific offering from you, the Novice Adulator. Find the right one and deliver it to the place of adulation, so the Supreme Beings don't destroy everything. While you're wandering around, talk to some of the locals and find out what they think about their overlords. Avoid the gaze of The Watchers who do not like Adulators. They can look vertically and horizontally, but can't look through blocks.

To Play
-------
Control your character with the arrow keys.
Arrow keys do everything in this game - move and interact with objects and characters.
If in doubt just press the arrow keys!

My idea
-------
I wanted to create a retro style maze game in Bitsy with more game play than my previous Bitsy games. I managed to include a couple of puzzles in it. (1) Choosing the right offering based on a sequence puzzle at the top of the screen. (2) Choosing the right paths through The Watcher rooms. I had other puzzle ideas, but ran out of time. Originally I planned to create the mazes, text and tiles/sprites/items with a tool I'd developed to generate them randomly, but that didn't work out. However, most of the graphics are tweaked versions of the original random tiles, and a lot of the character and item text was randomly generated as well.

Thanks to Adam Le Doux for creating Bitsy.

![bitsy ldjam april2020 screen3.png](///raw/fa2/3/z/2c496.png)

items.name: Conway's Garden of Life
items.body:
![screenshot.png](///raw/73c/41/z/2c747.png)

It's what it says on the tin, Conway's Game Of Life done in "garden" form.

Done in a rush for Ludum Dare 46: Keep It Alive

No sounds, sorry. :(


Controls:

- Left mouse - plant and remove crops.

- R - Reset the stage.


Goals:

- There is no way to win (though there's definitely a way to lose). Collect as many berries as you can while trying to avoid "wasting" crops.

- Treat it as a toy more than a game. There's not a huge consequence to losing, really.

- It is extremely easy to get a berry farm going that just produces live crops forever. Don't worry about it.

- Crops are only 'wasted' if you pick them up when they are 'dead'. Crops can be revived if there are enough live plants near them.

- Berries will only form if Conway's plant can sustain in place for 3 days or longer.



Tips:
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life#Examples_of_patterns
 this wikipedia might come in handy ;)


Known bugs:

- Dead plants will reset to first stage when coming back alive.

Additional resources used:

- Super Mario 2 font https://www.dafont.com/super-mario-bros-2.font



Notes: This was pretty rushed due to having roughly only 20 hours of the 48 hour jam to make a thing... it shows.

items.name: Crossing Animals
items.body:
[![PlayImage.png](///raw/578/z/2b6c7.png)](http://crossinganimals.fun/)
[Play here!](http://crossinganimals.fun/)

Crossing Animals is a game about keeping wildlife alive next to busy car roads! The animals have their own free will, and it is up to you to stop the cars in time.

Playing is simple! Clicking or touching the cars will make them perform an emergency stop, use this to stop them from driving into the wildlife. If you can do this for 60 seconds without any accidents, you win the level!

![ezgif.com-gif-maker.gif](///raw/578/z/2b64c.gif)

This game was created for the Ludum Dare 46 game jam compo. The game and source code to the game is available here.

Thanks!

items.name: Keep the Garden Alive
items.body:
![LD46-00006a.gif](///raw/c4a/z/2c497.gif)

**Controls:**
```
	    			| Keyboard		| Gamepad	
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Move and Aim   	 | WASD			| Left Stick / D-Pad	
Jump/Select		 | K			   | A Button
Water Spray		 | J			   | X Button
Weed Killer		 | I			   | Y Button
Bug Spray	   	| L			   | B Button
```

**How to Play:**

Keep all your flowers alive for as long as possible by regularly spraying them with water.
Weeds and bugs will keep appearing, which will make flowers die quicker, so exterminate them with weed killer and bug spray.
Game is over when all flowers are dead.

items.name: Rogue Janitor
items.body:
Like all things in this world, the ones who keep things alive are the ones who receive the least appreciation or recognition.

In Rogue Janitor you play as Grolig, the Goblin Janitor. You work for Ooolag the Demon King in his Dungeon as one of the custodial staff.

After defeating the last wave of Human Heroes, Ooolag took everyone out for drinks to celeberate. Things got a bit out of hand, and now it's 2pm, you're hungover and you realise you forgot to clean up the dungeon before next shift!

Rush through the procedurally generated dungeon levels and tidy up before the next wave of humans arrive, if the humans arrive before you're finished cleaning and resetting the treasure you'll get fired and the Dungeon will shut down! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twu2ZMaaRbw&feature=emb_title

items.name: Solar Colonizer
items.body:
A game where you manage your planets, creatures, and spaceships. the objective is to make your creatures colonize the entire solar system

Controls: Left click
                    Right click: move the camera

Objective:
colonize the whole solar system by evolving your microorganisms to animals, 
then to scientists so they can build ships. do not let them die!

Tips:
*after purchasing a planet, you have to select it's location:-
   -red ring ---> hot area (produces alot of firestone)
   -green ring ---> warm area (suitable for microorganisms and scientists, they
evolve over time)
   -blue ring ---> cold area (produces alot of icesstone)
*the more you place planets, the more recources you get, but harder to colonize
the entire system!
*only normal planets can and should be colonized, asteroid belts and gas giants
aren't included
*you only can build spaceships when there are scientist species in one of your
planets
*if the planet that contains the scientist species die or when you have no more 
planets, you will lose!

items.name: Whale Dive
items.body:
## The Game

A giant sperm whale was plummeting from the sky above an alien planet - a planet with strange constructions, built by unknown creatures - constructions of wood, metal and strange plastic-like substances that would prove to be lethal if the whale were to crash into them.

Luckily, you are here to guide the whale in its fall. You and your joystick. *You have to keep the whale alive!*

![2020-04-20 01.38.56.jpg](///raw/b88/z/2c3f5.jpg)

The [Atari 2600](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atari_2600) (also known as Atari VCS, which is confusing as there's a recent product with that name), released in 1977 was one of the first home consoles. This is a game for that platform. A game about a whale that you need to guide so it avoids obstacles while it falls towards its home in the ocean.

## Instructions

**[Play it on the Javatari emulator online](https://javatari.org/?ROM=http://public.librador.com/whale-1.0.rom) or [Download the ROM to play on native emulator or real hardware](http://public.librador.com/whale-1.0.rom).**

Select level with left and right on the joystick. There are 3 levels. Press the fire button to start.

Make the whale go left and right with the joystick. If the whale hits something, you get one more chance, but if it happens again, it's bye-bye, whale! :cry:

You succeed if you manage to guide the whale all the way to the blue sea.

## Known issues

  * The graphics on the level selection screen is misaligned on some platforms. It does not happen in the online emulators I have tested it on, but it can be seen in Stella 5.1.1 and on my Atari 2600.

  * Sorry for sounding like a graphical artist, but on my Atari and TV set, the colors are very different from the emulators. Maybe because the TV doesn't handle the NTSC signal properly. Or maybe just because by poor Atari is very old.

items.name: Prime Rush
items.body:
In the year 2020, an unforeseen catastrophe has forced the Human population to take shelter at home, relying on Online Shopping to purchase all goods. Overwhelmed with purchase orders and endless boxed goods to be shipped out, can YOU keep the packing line of one online retailer giant alive?

Prime Rush is a Tetris-meets-Overcooked co-op game where players attempt to work together to eliminate lines of package boxes slamming through the package line by organizing them into full lines of boxes before shipping them out.

![demo.png](///raw/2fa/03/z/2c438.png)

Tools used:  
Unity for coding  
SketchUp for 3D Models  
Mixamo for Rigging

LDJam  @hlo-world  
Github [hlo-world](https://github.com/hlo-world/)

Ludum Dare 46 - Keep it Alive  
Compo submission by Harris Lo

items.name: Efi
items.body:
![efi_definitive_low.gif](///raw/754/z/2c5b3.gif)

```
About the game.-
```

A short arcade game about a mama bird on a quest to rescue her children.

Made by Ludipe during Ludum Dare 46 in 48 hours with music by Faizyr (audio rating is disabled). **For rating purposes you may choose to download "efi_compo_win64.zip" from itchio. That build features a music loop made by me instead of the one by Faizyr used in the main build.** That's the only difference between that build and the others.

```
Instructions.-
```

**These are all included in game. You control the main character with either the arrow keys or A/D. You can pause the game pressing space. The game will end once you find the 20 birds.**

The game should activate fullscreen after the intro, **I recommend playing it on fullscreen**. You can also activate fullscreen using the icon on the right bottom corner (on the browser version) or pressing F on the desktop version.

```
Misc.-
```

**This game is harder than the ones I usually make**. Took me 4 minutes and 10 deaths to complete the last build before releasing it, then again, I had been practising for two days. Once you get to the end the game will show how many times you have died.

items.body:
As aliens spacecrafts start descending upon our planet, and the acting President is doing nothing to stop them, NASA's Commander Quill is Earth's last hope of defending the invaders.

Progress through 3 painfully hand-drawn ASCII-based levels and enjoy the subtle political satire throughout.

This game is totally related to the theme. Just as you are pronouncing "Keep it Alive", you look up to the sky, see the aliens, and end up saying "Aliens" instead.

* Download the Mac and Windows executables [here](https://ostr.itch.io/keep-it-aliens).

items.name: Feed Them, With A Gun!
items.body:
![Reference.PNG](///raw/017/e2/z/2c6ac.png)

Feed the Animals by Shooting them [Left-Mouse-Click , Mouse Position]. 

You Cannot Continuously Fire, Bullets Take Time To Load.

As You Feed The Animals, You Collect Currency,.

If You Have Enough Currency, Upgrade Options Will Start To Appear (above the player). Clicking Them Will Activate The Upgrade.

The Upgrade Options Available Are -

1 [LEFT] - Automatic Feeders - They Feed Animals Which Are Closest To Them Within A Range.

2[MIDDLE] - New Animal - A new Animal Pops Up.

3[RIGHT] - Expand Your Area.

(Currency required increases for each upgrade)



The Game Ends If Your Currency Is Below 0.

The Highest Animal Population You Are Able To Reach Is Your Score.


Softwareâs Used 

Godot - Game Engine 

Pixelorama - Pixel Art 

Bosca Ceoil - Music 

BFXR - SFX

font download link - https://opengameart.org/content/minimalist-pixel-fonts [CC0]

items.name: The Little Ship That Could
items.body:
![title.gif](///raw/5f6/e2/z/2c254.gif)

Mouse and headphones recommended.

A game about a little **damaged space ship** that can **barely move**. However, it can still **dodge-roll** its way out of trouble just fine - that is, if the pilot is **skilled** enough.

[![gameplay.gif](///raw/5f6/e2/z/2c20a.gif)](https://gama11.github.io/LudumDare46/)

If you're struggling to make it past the first few waves, make sure you're utilizing the "lock" mechanic - it lets you park the ship in a safe spot for a bit while moving the mouse to a suitable dodge roll target.

### How far can you make it? Share your highscores!

---

It's been quite a while since I participated in Ludum Dare (last one was LD 26), or made a game at all for that matter. This turned out better than expected!

_This game may or may not be a symptom of playing too much Exit the Gungeon recently._

---

#### Tools used:

- Game Engine: [HaxeFlixel](https://haxeflixel.com/)
- Programming Language: [Haxe](https://haxe.org/)
- Art: GIMP
- Music: [Bosca Ceoil](https://boscaceoil.net/)
- Sounds: [Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/)

The code is an unholy mess, so exercise caution when looking at it.

items.name: Keep E.T Alive
items.body:
_ Hello fellow Developers and Gamers!_ 

**First** let me start with this! I was aware about **Ludum Dare** for a long time, but I never participated in it. That changed this weekend :smile: ! I finally decided to give this event a go and to try to develop a game in Unity! I have messed around with Unity before, but I never managed to "produce" something. That changed today as I've just "finished" my first "game" in it -> **Keep E.T Alive**.

So as name of the game suggest I **followed** the idea of the **theme** ... perhaps too much :smile:. E.T has returned from his home planet back to Earth. He realized that he is missing some of the finest things from Earth - such as _Beer_ or _Meat_. But he is very exhausted from the trip so you need to keep him alive! Feed him, don't let him be thirsty and also clean after him. He may occasionally start to bleed as he is adjusting to earthly atmosphere again, so take care of that too!

![e.t.png](///raw/d4b/03/z/2c447.png)

Few **Notes** from my development process:
- **Graphics** - First I wanted to go with pixel-art, but I quickly realized that I will not have time for it as I'm not very - good at drawing it (it's something I definitely want to improve on in future). So I decided for super fast solution -> MS Paint. All Sprites were drawn with it, hardest part was E.T itself as I had to combine different shapes, in different angles and sizes. I used GIMP for adding transparent layers.
- **Code** - In my professional life I am front-end React developer so when I realized that I can just use VSCode I was super happy! I set up few things, configured some extensions and I started coding right away! I learned a lot as this was basically my first project in Unity (they made their docs really easy to read). One thing that helped me a lot was plugin iTween recommended by a friend.
- **Audio** - This might have been my favorite part. I laughed whole time as I was creating and editing those sound effects. Good thing that I had that beer in fridge and also duck tape.

Things that I would **improve or change**:
Biggest problem was the time. There are a couple of things that I really wanted to add to the game but I just didn't have time.
1. **Animations** for E.T - right now E.T looks super blunt and it worsens overall feeling from the game. I wanted to add expressions to his face when beer was close to his Infusion or face of guilt when he would poop himself.
2. Another **Need** for E.T - there was a plan to add one more item iPhone with airpods. Player would have to give E.T airpods to both ears and then start song on iPhone (it would also change game sound loop) and than when E.T would have enough of listening, remove them and stop the song.
3. Better **music** - game sound loops were the last things I worked on and it shows. I used this web app https://beepbox.co/ to create some songs but I am really not happy with outcomes. I felt like my head wanted to explode at some point.

Overall I am super happy that I did this. I learned a lot, got nice experience and mainly it was **super fun**. I definitely will try next Ludum Dare! Heck, I might start working on some other game in meanwhile just because I might feel like it!

items.name: UFO Shield
items.body:
Two alien races went to war and one got almost entirely wiped out, only one egg remains, and they want it gone.
You have to protect it from all the missiles by building around it.

**Note to Linux users**: I have provided a Linux build, but I really strongly urge you to build it yourself, due to library incompatibilities.

**Note to people who like looking at the code**: Try not to have an aneurysm, I gave up on writing high quality code 1 day in.

The color of your cursor indicates what you can do: if it's gray you can place blocks, if it's purple you don't have any more blocks, and if it's red you can't place a block there.

items.name: Vampire BloodLust 3D
items.body:
WOW !

My last LD was two years ago ... now I understand why I waited so long : this is so intense ! 

Every LD I try to challenge myself with something new. This time I wanted to create a Raycasting game with plain JS and HTML5. For sure that was a challenge ! Espcially when I realised that the tutorial that I was following only explained how to draw walls but not sprites :smile: .

I'm happy that I found some time to compose a theme and work on the audio even if I would've like to create more assets (wall texture etc) and create more animations. 


I hope that you will have some fun playing my game :slight_smile: 


####  :warning: GamePlay notice :warning:

Use arrow keys to move

Space bar to activate your power (you can go through walls) but mind your health bar !


####  :tools: Tools that I used 

- Music : https://musiclab.chromeexperiments.com/Song-Maker/ (great tool that I discovered during this LD)

- Graphism : https://www.piskelapp.com/

- Audio : My cell phone and https://twistedwave.com/online

- RayCasting tutorial : https://permadi.com/1996/05/ray-casting-tutorial-table-of-contents/

Chains was depeloped using Unity under 48 hours  during the game jam Ludum Dare 46 solo compo (Theme: Keep it alive).
