items.name: Rewilding: The Story of Wolfhead Valley
items.body:
![Screeny1-small.png](///raw/b6f/c2/z/2c478.png)

Welcome to Wolfhead Valley! It's been a long time since we had a scientist such as yourself come visit.

In Rewilding: The Story of Wolfhead Valley you are a rewilding specialist sent to help restore the valley's natural ecosystem after decades of human disruption.

For 3 (in-game, very short) years you are going to plant forests, seed meadows, and reintroduce rabbits, deer, and wolves (make sure they all have enough food before you do, or they won't last long!)

Each spring you will have the ability to add more plants and animals to the valley, then sit back and see how it develops over the rest of the year.

At the end of the 3 years, your efforts will be judged based on how much wildlife you've managed to keep alive. Good luck!

items.name: ROBOTFRIEND
items.body:
![sceenShot.png](///raw/0e8/8/z/2c40d.png)

While on a dangerous mission, your robot's locomotion system broke! You'll need to protect your robot friend while it repairs itself.

Fetch and give to your robot batteries. They are necessary to maintain its shield, or boost its abilities. 

Batteries

There are three types of battery.

- Blue: increase shields.
- Yellow: Improves rate of fire for a short amount of time.
- Red: Activates super weapon for a short amount of time.

Controls

- Left click while close to a battery to pick it up.
- Left click while close to robot to give battery.
- Press space to dash.

items.name: The Last Life
items.body:
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/207/e2/z/2c217.png)

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/207/e2/z/2c213.png)




The Last Life is a top-down shooter with wave survival mechanics.

Story: 
In 2020 a zombie virus spread around the Earth, killing almost every living being there is...

You are a lone wolf, who spent the last 20 years surviving in this terrible environment. After a while all your supplies run out and you decide to go and look for a better place to stay. You decide that it's a good idea to pack all of your stuff with you and head out into the open world. After a while you find something you haven't seen in ages - a living tree! After that, you decide to protect this precious form of life with your own life and defend it against the deadly zombies.

Controls:

WASD or ARROW KEYS - move

Mouse 1 - Shoot

F - Open/Close Shop

Goal: 
Survive for as long as possible.

items.name: myBUDDY O.S.
items.body:
Clippy has been replaced with the BRAND NEW myBUDDY OS. He's a helpful computer friend that does everything from running your computer and managing your network to making your dinner and filing your taxes. But watch out! There are things out there that want to harm myBUDDY and steal your data. Can you keep him alive and fend off the attackers?


## How To Play
Enemies will try to bet up myBUDDY when they see him. You have to click on them until they disappear. There will also be power ups that show up from time to time. They will increase your attacks against the enemies.

- Antivirus increases attack damage against Viruses
- CPU upgrades increases attack damage against Worms
- RAM upgrades increases attack damage against Malware
- Email Filters increase attack damage against Spam
- Firewalls increase attack damage against Hackers
- AIs increase attack damage against Crypto Miners
- Warranties increase MAX HP

## Enemies
- Virus - ![Virus.png](///raw/d11/z/2c443.png)

Please take a look at the full README at <https://github.com/lawnchairsociety/LD46/blob/master/README.md> for a list of all features, collectable achievements, and issues.

items.name: Keep the Evil Sewer Clown Alive
items.body:
![finish1.png](///raw/aad/c2/z/2c256.png)

Hi.

This is a game about kidnapping children and feeding them to an Evil Sewer Clown. Actually, Evil Sewer Clown is kind of a long name. But I just can't think of a name that fits better...oh well. I'm sure it's not a problem. And I'm even more sure I won't get any threatening legal letters if I don't think of any better names.

![finish4.gif](///raw/aad/c2/z/2c20d.gif)

"Wait a minute, there's no clown in that gif at all!"

Yes, this is true. I don't know how to draw clowns, and therefore, I was unable to put one into the game. Also, this is the first game I've ever made, so take it easy, sheeeesh. Anyways, that gif shows most of the gameplay. Drag the children into the sewers and run away from cops. Maybe I shouldn't have spoiled it all in one gif.

You know, I hear if you get to Level 100 without getting hit by any cops, there's an awesome final boss fight where you rise up against the Evil Sewer Clown.

Or maybe not. Who knows? Look in the source code if you care enough. And if you don't mind going blind from awful code practices.

Here's some more screenshots. Everyone likes those.

![finish2.png](///raw/aad/c2/z/2c27b.png)

![finish3.png](///raw/aad/c2/z/2c280.png)



And for the brave reader who actually made it this far down the page, here's an extra special making-of screenshot. Just for you.

![progress1.png](///raw/aad/c2/z/2c28c.png)

Yeah, it's not that great. That's ok, neither is this game.

Thanks for reading!

items.name: Save The Puppy by Kerpter
items.body:
Hi! 
We made a game about meeting a puppy and keeping her ALIVE! The game contains steps of mini-games that you should beat while not damage the dogs comfort too much. Your mission is to be the greatest veterinarian this Earth has seen. For people who play our game, your feedback is very important to us so don't forget to give us some feedback so that we could improve the game and our game development skills!



Levels:
1-Stomach:
Your job is to pass the road to the stomach without touching your surroundings with the magent. Touching objects will create discomfort for the puppy. When you find the stomach you should attach the screw tou yourself and go back the way you came but be carefull try to attach the screw strategically. You don't want to create discomfort to the puppy with your screw by touching to its surroundings as well!
How To Play:
WASD to control & to attach the screw just touch it with your character.
2-Leg:
HELP! We need to cure this dogs leg. Controll the missing bone and transport it through a 2D Platformer type mini-game. Be carefull on this journey.
How To Play:
WASD to controll & Wall jump if press W while you touch a right or left side of a wall.
3-Eye:
This poor dog has bacterias all over her face. You should clean her up. however be carefull. You need be accurate and fast so that the puppy will remain calm.
How To Play:
Upper Zone game only need one time press Space. However you should press it at the right time.
Lower Zone game is abouut speed. Press Space as many time you can! 
4-Mind:
So you cured her physically but what about her soul. Let's play Catch with her. Just press the required keys ( Q W E R ) while the ball is in the zone (the area between lines)

items.name: Power  Defense Game
items.body:
Make sure your battery life doesn't run out. Otherwise, you lose! In this game, your are trying to keep your phone alive, while making sure your phone battery doesn't break and making sure you don't let hackers steal too much of your battery life. 

### Instructions:

You are trying to keep your battery life from getting to 0 while upgrading your phone and buying batteries. When you upgrade your phone, you make more money, and your battery life is drained slower. However, your battery will decrease no matter what level phone you are at. You can recharge your battery 0-10 times, (Different battery levels allow more recharges) but once it breaks, you have to buy a new one at Ahmazoon. To make the game harder, there will be hackers that drain your battery life at an inconsistent rate. You can also go to Ahmazoon in order to buy something that makes the hackers drain less battery each time. When you buy your phone, you will receive a question. If you answer the question right, you will get extra money to help you throughout the game. Answer it  wrongâ¦ and you will have to pay the price. Finally, have fun!

items.name: That Time I Crossed A Barren Desert To Protect&Care The World From Terrible Code
items.body:
# The year is 2038. 

After a decade of trouble, Apple decided to finally crush the IT sector by using brute force. 
You are Nem, the owner of the last surviving copy of the K&R Bible that hasn't been snatched by Apple. Should it be lost, millions of incompetent coders will write terrible C and Apple will eventually become a monopoly.

The book, Nem. You must keep it alive to keep IT alive!!!

![2b69a.gif](///raw/f90/1/z/2c480.gif)

# Controls

Use the **mouse** to clear Nem's path. The book is too large; she can't see what's in front of her!

Pat her head 3 times to restart.

I recommend using a real mouse. I think it might be unbeatable with a trackpad/trackpoint.

# Acknowledgements

Using soundfonts: "Aegean Symphonic Orchestra" and one of the "20 free synth soundfonts"

# Video 

https://youtu.be/hQDsGSOfUow

# Lesson learned

Everyone and their grandmother use a game engine, and I don't. I didn't do my homework and didn't prepare anything aside from the previous LD game's code, so I wrote everything from almost ground zero. Therefore, even though I'm happy with how it turned out, it could have been better if I hadn't spent several hours on collision.

![Balloony Icon.png](///raw/b82/d/z/2c329.png)
Do whatever you can to save little Billy's balloon! You can use your hand to hit the balloon by moving your mouse. Every time you tap a balloon you get a point. You can buy several things to keep your balloon afloat, but look out, they'll break after some time! It's not a party unless we add more balloons! You don't have to save these balloons, but keeping them alive increases your score! Now, it can't be that easy. Parties are dangerous! Several obstacles will try to stop you from surviving, but as long as you keep your red balloon alive, all is good! Play multiple times to try and beat your high score. Good Luck!

## **Description**

Keep yourself, it, and a decaying space station alive by buying yourself enough time to escape.

## **Desktop Controls**

Z to discharge oxygen

Z+X to quit game

X key to perform the following actions in priority order:
* shoot gun

O button represents the Z key in the format

items.name: Zilogever
items.body:
Keep the Amstrad CPC alive by playing like I did by programming...

Process the information quickly enough (with left and right arrows) so as not to have an overflow! If you are fast enough, the next level will show you that you cannot compete with a Z80 CPU :)

![story.png](///raw/ba1/z/2c2e9.png)

HOW TO PLAY
- Download the virtual Amstrad CPC disk (ld46.dsk, see below)
- Use an Amstrad emulator locally (like WinAPE or WinCPC), or use an online Amstrad CPC emulator (like https://www.retrovm.com/ which is slightly too fast)
- Insert the disk ld46.dsk
- Execute the program zilogevr.bas with this command: run "zilogevr.bas"

![game.png](///raw/ba1/z/2c2dd.png)

INSTRUCTION
Press the left/right arrow when the information is in the blue area.

Note that there is no sound unfortunately.

items.name: CORRUPT TUNDRA
items.body:
![screenshot2.png](///raw/659/c/z/2c5e8.png)

# ABOUT

CORRUPT TUNDRA is my entry into the Ludum Dare 46 compo, with the theme "keep it alive". In this game, you defend your campfire from the "corruption", glitchy ice monsters who HATE your fire.

# HOW TO PLAY

You need to keep your campfire alive. Enemies will head straight for your fire from all angles, ignoring you completely. To defeat an enemy, smack it with your torch. Use your jetpack to move around the tundra quickly. If an enemy gets close to your campfire, a warning will appear on your screen to let you know.

Destroying an enemy will increase your combo meter.  Keeping your combo streak going is the key to getting a high score. Occasionally, you'll need to stray far from your fire to keep your meter up. If you're in a situation where you don't think you can make it back to your fire in time to save it, you can transfer your campfire to a new location by burning a tree down, though this will clear your multiplier.

Have fun, and thanks for playing!

# CONTROLS

- **WASD** - Movement
- **Space** - Use jetpack
- **Left mouse** - Swing torch
- **Right mouse** - Burn tree, convert to campfire
- **P** - Pause
- **Esc** - Exit game
- **1** - Switch between fullscreen/windowed. May be slightly glitchy!
- **2** - Toggle screen shaders

# TOOLS

- **LOVE 2D** - Game engine
- **Pico-8, bfxr, and Audacity** - Sound creation
- **http://terrain.party** - Terrain height map
- **https://www.dafont.com/vcr-osd-mono.font** - Font

items.name: Squish
items.body:
Protect gelatinous martian life form Squish for as long as you can!

My idea was basically that a Mars rover located the first ever alien life form.  But the catch is it was going to be a struggle to keep it from splatting on the ground while it's being transported.  Mostly just a story that went along with the mechanics of the game as they progressed.  Originally I thought about someone dropping a bomb in a factory, and a machine tried to keep it from exploding.  But I couldn't do the art for an indoor factory / lab setting, and I realized I could use the martian terrain from reference images.

My wife just asked me to dedicate this to her, so sure honey, this game can be dedicated to you!  It's my first ever game jam, and if I could do it all over again I'd rush to get a fully working prototype up and running before starting any polish, audio creation, sprite creation, etc.  Had a great time, I'll definitely be submitting in October as well!  Good luck everyone, I can't wait to see all of your games! :)

Thanks,
Jake

items.name: Life of the Party
items.body:
# Life of the Party

![lotp_ss_01.png](///raw/93a/z/2c37a.png)

## Description
You've decided to host a party, and all the guests have arrived!  Your job is to keep their interest high by engaging in conversation with them.  That should be a snap, even for someone as socially awkward as you!

## Controls
- **WASD:** Move
- **1 through 5:** Quickly select a conversation topic
- **Q/E or Mouse Wheel:** Cycle through conversation topics
- **Space or Left Mouse Button:** Talk
- **Z or Right Mouse Button:** Research
- **Escape:** Quit

![lotp_ss_02.png](///raw/93a/z/2c37d.png)

## Gameplay
- Talk to guests in order to keep their interest high.  If interest drops too low (indicated by the guest changing color), they will leave the party.
- When talking to a guest, they will reply with a similar topic (same shape or color).  You can only keep the conversation going by replying with a similar topic as well (same shape or color, but not both).  Any other topic will confuse or anger them.  (The first topic you speak to a guest about is always a good topic.)
- You will automatically store the topic a guest talks to you about, replacing whatever topic you told them.  (If only one guest remains, the topic will not be stored.)
- To get new topics or replace existing ones, Research on your phone, which provides a new random topic into your current slot.  This takes a couple of seconds, so don't be on your phone too excessively!
- If all the guests leave, the party is officially dead.  The timer will show you how long you kept the party going.  Fee; free to post your best times in the comments below!

## Credits
- All programming, graphics, music and sound were created by: Mark J. Hadley

# Keep it Burning
You are cold, hungry and in a forest alone.
The only chance of survival is finding heat, but you have no matches or any way of starting a fire...
A lightning strikes in front of you! A bush catches fire: This is your only chance! 
You grab your axe, and run to the nearest tree! Time to gather some firewood and **KEEP IT BURNING**

### Gameplay
Gather wood from nearby trees and fuel the fire that was started
Keep warm and add fuel to the fire to keep it burning and alive in the rain

Walk with WASD
Click on trees to chop them
Click on the fire to add logs to it

### Music and SFX
Music and SFX was made in FL Studio by myself

### Art
Art was drawn on a touchpad in Aseprite (It was painful)

### Code
Coded in VS Code without Intellisense since it broke in the last update :/

items.name: Castronaut
Flora is chilling
items.body:
Here's my second submission for Ludum dare

I wanted to create a pretty chill game with childish graphics for this theme. You basically have to take care of a little flower. You'll have to give it the water it needs and defend it against dangerous ennemies !

The game is pretty straightforward and very simple, you'll have to develop the flower until it reaches lvl 5. The idea behind it was that it would become a beautiful orchid at the end.

![Flower2.png](///raw/f7e/32/z/2c362.png)

If the flower has enough water you'll earn "Flower points" that you can spend on water, leveling up or to call the angry birds for rescue. It also gains health points if supplied with enough water. The more water it has, the more points you get. Water supply is maxed at 100, like health point and flower points are not capped

Slugs will have a chance to spawn and will try to eat the flower. The chance of spawn raises with the level (very rare on level 1, not so much after). You'll need to call the angry birds to defend it. Watch out, each angry bird will only attack a limited amount of time.

![call_the_police.png](///raw/f7e/32/z/2c374.png)

I would have loved to add a proper soundtrack or effects for this game, especially with wind sound to add an ambiance to the game, but here is my compo for this Ludum dare 46 !

Developped in Python, using the pygame library.

items.name: Spread
items.body:
# Spread (Pandemic Simulation Game)

### Ludum Dare "The Compo"

### April 2020 Submission

### Game by SapporoVHS ("midisaurus")

Survive 30 days of the pandemic.

Roads connect cities to industries:
- No oil = Bad Economy
- No medical = cities cannot test.
- No telecoms = no city info

Close roads to slow the virus spread from other cities.

Lock-down cities to slow the virus but also slow the economy.

Start testing in cities to slow the virus,and boost the medical industry.

*Virus is slowed more with longer testing.

Reach Day 30 with Economy > 50 and Virus < 50:
- 3 Cities Remaining = SSS
- 2 Cities Remaining = SS
- 1 City Remaining = S

Otherwise, just reach Day 30:
- 3 Cities Remaining = A
- 2 Cities Remaining = B
- 1 City Remaining = C

![spread_screenshot_gameplay.png](///raw/14b/03/z/2c3a3.png)

items.name: Rocket Maniacs
items.body:
Welcome to Rocket Maniacs, the most dangerous and extreme game show on the planet!

In this game show the rules are simple. The contestant will have to reach the prize money on a rocket powered hover board with a bomb strapped to his back. To keep himself alive he must keep his momentum alive or the bomb will blow up. Very simple.

In today's episode the contestant must traverse through rooftops of Neo Helsinki, the prize money is hidden high up on top of a crane. Can he keep his momentum alive or will he blow up? Stay tuned to find out! Let's get started!

![fte-20200420015811-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/2c32d.png)

The game is kind of a 3D platformer set on city rooftops. You must keep your momentum up to reach the goal.


Controls: Mouse / Arrows to steer, W / Up to boost, S / Down to brake, Space to jump.


Source code is included in the game/src directory under MIT in all the downloads.

items.name: Terrible Spaceship Design
items.body:
The location is unknown, the resources are non-existant, and whoever designed your spaceship is definitely insane!

In this game you control a spaceship with a slightly weird design decision: the gun is attached to the main body by a single cable. As if moving around wasn't bad enough, your gun is also the only fragile part of the entire thing! On top of that, your energy is running lower every second and you must replenish it by picking random green rectangles I never thought what should be.

Your gun is very fragile, so you better keep it alive!

Engine used was Unity, sounds generated using sfxr.

items.name: Ralathor takes a nap
items.body:
Ralathor is sleeping! You must protect him!

--Controls --

LMB - Swing the mighty hammer!

RMB - Summon a space knight for 15 gold!!


[Zootttt.png](///raw/01b/03/z/2c542.png)

items.name: Outpowered
items.body:
We can't survive here any longer, they are just too many. If we repair our generator, we have a chance to get out of here. Find the missing parts, keep the generator powered, destroy anyone trying to stop us!

Stay close to your generator to refill its power bar. When you move away, it will drain slowly. Don't let it deplete, and you'll be fine.

Approaching enemies will move on the generator. Destroy them before they can reach it. Do what you must to keep the generator alive!
![screen.png](///raw/3cc/31/z/2c2e8.png)

items.name: Chrashsite
items.body:
My first Ludum Dare game! And it's even finished! Splendid!

You've chrashed your helicopter, can you rebuild it with only an axe and a fire that threatens to run out of fuel at any time?

Keep track of your fuel and other resources in the upper left corner. If you run out of fuel it's game over for you, buddy. You can create more fuel in addition to numerous buildings and upgrades by using the number keys while close to the fire. You get the resources needed for this by walking up to trees (and later on rocks) and swinging your axe into them. I'll leave it up to you to discover what all the upgrades do, I'm sure you'll do fine.

Good luck!

![SkÃ¤rmbild (107).png](///raw/90b/2/z/2c1e5.png)

![SkÃ¤rmbild (105).png](///raw/90b/2/z/2c1f0.png)

Controls: 
- W and S for forwards and backwards movement.
- A and D to rotate your character and swing your axe.
- Shift to sprint (when unlocked)
- I to toggle ironworks (when unlocked, important to remember since they drink fuel like I've been drinking tea)
- R to restart
- Escape to exit

Tools:
- Unity
- Krita (poorly used as you may see)
- LMMS (also poorly used, playing in a wind orchestra for 10 years hasn't prepared me for this)
- Audacity

Since this is only my second original game ever I know it's not very good but I can't help but be proud of it anyway. Please make sure you give me plenty of harsh critique so I can convince myself I shouldn't be.

items.name: Forever Green
items.body:
INSTRUCTIONS:

Use the Plant seeds button to start planting seeds. The seeds will become beans aftera certain amount of time. You can speed this time up by applying fertilizers to the seeds.

Once they become beans they can be eating by insects and you also need to water them frequently. Deploy pesticide to make the insects stay away from the crops.

You loose the game if all your crops die, or get eaten.

Controls: You control the entire game with the buttons at the bottom. The tractor will follow a set path, so it will be easier for you to keep the early seeds in the path alive.

HINTS: I'm not sure the fertilizer is worth it right now, the growth time may be a bit to short.

CURRENT ISSUES:

THe WebGL builds seems to have some issues with audio, I currently have about halft the sound effects, and another person reported they had none.
The game is also a bit to easy I think

Windows build will be added shortly.

items.name: Your Very Own Rising Pet
items.body:
As many of us IRL are looking for yeast and finding there isn't any in the stores, I've taken to trying to raise a sourdough baby. Here's that experience in game form! 

Your Very Own Rising Pet is a twine game, I made half of the audio and used ChapelR's code for an audio library in Harlowe, but other than that I did it all myself! 

All you need is a mouse or your finger on touch compatible devices, and there are audio controls on the left-hand side. I hope you enjoy!

items.name: FTL ON

items.name: theColony
items.body:
A group of colonists have exhausted their last resources. In a desperate attempt to survive they gather all they have left to construct a spaceship - the Colonia - to forage for food and material among the neighboring  lanets. There is enough food to survive for five days. Gather materials to upgrade the ship, or food to feed the hungry. Be aware that as planets' resources are depleted only an upgraded ship will be able to reach more food in time.


- W - forward thrust
- S - minor reverse thrust
- A/D - turn left/right

- Space - Open map
- E - Enter orbit around planet

Use the mouse to transfer food and/or materials to your ship while in orbit around a planet. Food and materials will be transferred to the home planet automatically when docked there.

items.name: Seeds of Eru
items.body: This is my third entry for LDjam. I have to say I have way more fun building a game like this now that I have a better understanding of Unity and C#. It was also the first time I used Blender. I was really surprised at how easily and smooth Blender blends in with Unity. Had a blast making this, enjoy!

items.name: Feed the Fire
items.body:
![coverImage.png](///raw/30f/71/z/2c203.png)

# Description
A short game about keeping a fire alive with whatever fuel you can find. 
Approximate time to complete: 2 minutes

# How to Play

Run around finding items that you can throw into the fire. Pick them up when prompted and take them back to the fire pit to increase it's fuel. Keep going until there is no more fuel.

* W A S D/ Arrow Keys = Move character
* E = Pickup item (when prompted) and close dialog boxs.

In the top left of the screen is your fuel indicator and the top right shows your current held item

![gameplay.gif](///raw/30f/71/z/2c1de.gif)

# A final word

Thank you for playing this 'game'. I really appreciate it and i am super proud of what i've achieved here regardless of where i place.

This was my first ever submission to the Ludum Dare 46 Compo! I previously submitted a game to the Jam in LD42 as part of a team; but this was the first time going solo! As per the Compo rule all assets were made by myself using the following tools:

* Unity for the engine
* Aseprite to create the pixel 'art'
* Bosca Ceoilâ to create the music
* Audacity (and my microphone)to create the sound effects.
* YouTube/Stack Overflow/Google for answers to my gamedev problems.

Finally i tracked what i spent time on. Here's a quick breakdown: Sleeping/Breaks (19hrs), Dev (9hrs), Graphics (7.5hrs), Sound (4hrs), Polishing (6hrs). Total (26.5hrs working).

items.name: "Zen" Garden
items.body:
# Description

You are gardening peacefully when hoodlums starts wreaking havoc in your little sanctuary of peace.
This can only be solved in violence.

The theme was Keep it Alive. You need to grow your garden and keep it alive against dangerous people.

The game is hosted on itch.io.

# Controls

WASD or arrow keys to move around. Left Click to add a garden tile (This costs money). Right Click to shoot people. 

In the menu, Esc to quit and Enter to Start if you donât want to use the mouse.

# Screenshots

![play2.gif](///raw/d99/z/2c29d.gif)

![play-still.png](///raw/d99/z/2c2b0.png)


# Tools && Wrapup

This was my second time using Unity. I used Studio One for the audio and Aseprite for the graphisms.
If you have any questions, you can contact me on twitter [@tic_is_mad](https://twitter.com/tic_is_mad)

# Ratings

I did everything in the game except the background music.(I did the sfx.)

Scroll - Zoom Camera

Click on empty plot (when moving people) - Build New House

Click on existing house (when moving people) - Relocate People


Made for Ludum Dare 46, with the theme 'Keep it alive.'

items.name: Bodyguard
items.body:
![title_gif1.gif](///raw/43b/31/z/2c2a2.gif)

**Bodyguard** is an entry in the **Ludum Dare 46** gamejam with the theme **"Keep it alive"**.

You are the bodyguard and you must ensure the VIP stays alive by killing any would-be assassins. You'll receive radio communications to help you pin down which of the civilians is really an assassin.

![gameplay1_gif.gif](///raw/43b/31/z/2c2a8.gif)

Once you've found the assassin, take your shot before they have a chance to kill the VIP!

![success_gif.gif](///raw/43b/31/z/2c2a9.gif)

Play progressively harder levels with more and more civilians but try not to shoot any innocent bystanders, they won't like that very much.

**My high score is level 9, see if you can beat it!**

Some tips for success (Read if you don't care to discover them yourself):

* After 35 seconds the assassin can stab the VIP
* If someone walks through the VIP past 35 seconds, they probably aren't the assassin
* If you hear a sound and the screen shakes, the assassin tried to stab the VIP but failed. He's probably still close by!
* After 120 seconds the assassin will aggressively seek out the VIP
* Take a warning shot to stop the civilians for a second!

**Here's a video of the game in action:**
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Stg44OvBTqI

items.name: Keep My Keep Alive
items.body: This is my first Ludum Dare game. I did a "safe choice" and went with some easy gameplay that will test the quickest fingers. My focus for this game was to get the estetique right. I spent about half the time to get this game to look the way I envisioned it.

items.name: Floyd's Fire
items.body:
After thinking about it for a long time, you finally decided to give spelunking a try. 
You arrive to the location and everything was fine on your descent, when suddenly your ties got loose and you hit the cave's rock bottom. Your equipment is gone and you only have a torch. Just try not to think too much of the old tales about how the cave is haunted by the deceased spelunkers.

[ Objective ]
Your torch expires but you need to go as far as you can before the flame dies, your best options are:
1. Grab the flames that appear in the cave. 
2. Fight the ghosts to slow down your flame expiration.

[ Controls ]

Movement: WASD / Arrows
Pause = Escape

[ Ghost ]

Each ghost have hit points (yellow squares) but they have a flame cost (yellow number), is it worthy? well check how many seconds will you gain (blue number).

Hit them by sharing your fears and sharing the same tile has many times as hits are necessary.


[ Finally ]

Sadly I couldn't add audio in time.
Have fun and thank you for your time!

items.name: The Next Generation (Conway's Game of Life Puzzles)
items.body:
Inspired by the recent passing of [John Conway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Horton_Conway), I made a [Game of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life) puzzle game.

Each level gives you a goal pattern. Click the cells to create a start pattern, and then click the play button to apply the Game of Life rules. You win when the generated pattern matches the goal.

[![tng.PNG](///raw/da0/2/z/2c2d0.png)](https://happycoding.io/gallery/the-next-generation-ld-46/index)

Play [here](https://happycoding.io/gallery/the-next-generation-ld-46/index)!

# A final word

Thank you for playing this 'game'. I really appreciate it and i am super proud of what i've achieved here regardless of where i place.

This was my first ever submission to the Ludum Dare 46 Compo! I previously submitted a game to the Jam in LD42 as part of a team; but this was the first time going solo! As per the Compo rule all assets were made by myself using the following tools:

* Unity for the engine
* Aseprite to create the pixel 'art'
* Bosca Ceoilâ to create the music
* Audacity (and my microphone)to create the sound effects.
* YouTube/Stack Overflow/Google for answers to my gamedev problems.

Finally i tracked what i spent time on. Here's a quick breakdown: Sleeping/Breaks (19hrs), Dev (9hrs), Graphics (7.5hrs), Sound (4hrs), Polishing (6hrs). Total (26.5hrs working).

items.name: "Zen" Garden
items.body:
# Description

You are gardening peacefully when hoodlums starts wreaking havoc in your little sanctuary of peace.
This can only be solved in violence.

The theme was Keep it Alive. You need to grow your garden and keep it alive against dangerous people.

The game is hosted on itch.io.

# Controls

WASD or arrow keys to move around. Left Click to add a garden tile (This costs money). Right Click to shoot people. 

In the menu, Esc to quit and Enter to Start if you donât want to use the mouse.

# Screenshots

![play2.gif](///raw/d99/z/2c29d.gif)

![play-still.png](///raw/d99/z/2c2b0.png)


# Tools && Wrapup

This was my second time using Unity. I used Studio One for the audio and Aseprite for the graphisms.
If you have any questions, you can contact me on twitter [@tic_is_mad](https://twitter.com/tic_is_mad)

# Ratings

I did everything in the game except the background music.(I did the sfx.)

items.name: Disaster Island
items.body:
Can you build a civilization on an island that's constantly hit by natural disasters? :cloud_lightning: 

Grow your population by building new houses, and evaculate your people when natural disasters are about to strike! Keep your population alive! :house:

WASD - Move Camera

Scroll - Zoom Camera

Click on house - Move People

Click on empty plot (when moving people) - Build New House

Click on existing house (when moving people) - Relocate People


Made for Ludum Dare 46, with the theme 'Keep it alive.'

items.name: Bodyguard
items.body:
![title_gif1.gif](///raw/43b/31/z/2c2a2.gif)

**Bodyguard** is an entry in the **Ludum Dare 46** gamejam with the theme **"Keep it alive"**.

You are the bodyguard and you must ensure the VIP stays alive by killing any would-be assassins. You'll receive radio communications to help you pin down which of the civilians is really an assassin.

![gameplay1_gif.gif](///raw/43b/31/z/2c2a8.gif)

Once you've found the assassin, take your shot before they have a chance to kill the VIP!

![success_gif.gif](///raw/43b/31/z/2c2a9.gif)

Play progressively harder levels with more and more civilians but try not to shoot any innocent bystanders, they won't like that very much.

**My high score is level 9, see if you can beat it!**

Some tips for success (Read if you don't care to discover them yourself):

* After 35 seconds the assassin can stab the VIP
* If someone walks through the VIP past 35 seconds, they probably aren't the assassin
* If you hear a sound and the screen shakes, the assassin tried to stab the VIP but failed. He's probably still close by!
* After 120 seconds the assassin will aggressively seek out the VIP
* Take a warning shot to stop the civilians for a second!

**Here's a video of the game in action:**
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Stg44OvBTqI

items.name: Keep My Keep Alive
items.body: This is my first Ludum Dare game. I did a "safe choice" and went with some easy gameplay that will test the quickest fingers. My focus for this game was to get the estetique right. I spent about half the time to get this game to look the way I envisioned it.

items.name: Trollwoods
items.body:

Want to go camping in the wild? 
Keep your campfire alive, because it is dark outside, and you are not quite alone in the forest..

Use arrow keys to move, SPACE to switch your torch light.

A tiny evasion and resource management game with pixel art optics. Everything created, drawn, sampled, written during these 48hours using the great Godot engine, Pyxel Edit, Audacity, OpenMPT, Gimp and BFXR and my Keyboard. :smile:

A Ludum Dare 46 compo entry. / Made from scratch in 48h.

items.name: TP Defender
items.body:
TP Defender is a fast paced atmospheric shooting game where you defend yourself, and the rest of the world, from  inside your house from the Corona Virus using toilet paper.

![TP3.JPG](///raw/f91/92/z/2c261.jpg)

items.name: Floyd's Fire
items.body:
After thinking about it for a long time, you finally decided to give spelunking a try. 
You arrive to the location and everything was fine on your descent, when suddenly your ties got loose and you hit the cave's rock bottom. Your equipment is gone and you only have a torch. Just try not to think too much of the old tales about how the cave is haunted by the deceased spelunkers.

[ Objective ]
Your torch expires but you need to go as far as you can before the flame dies, your best options are:
1. Grab the flames that appear in the cave. 
2. Fight the ghosts to slow down your flame expiration.

[ Controls ]

Movement: WASD / Arrows
Pause = Escape

[ Ghost ]

Each ghost have hit points (yellow squares) but they have a flame cost (yellow number), is it worthy? well check how many seconds will you gain (blue number).

Hit them by sharing your fears and sharing the same tile has many times as hits are necessary.


[ Finally ]

Sadly I couldn't add audio in time.
Have fun and thank you for your time!

items.name: Rocket Maniacs
items.body:
Welcome to Rocket Maniacs, the most dangerous and extreme game show on the planet!

In this game show the rules are simple. The contestant will have to reach the prize money on a rocket powered hover board with a bomb strapped to his back. To keep himself alive he must keep his momentum alive or the bomb will blow up. Very simple.

In today's episode the contestant must traverse through rooftops of Neo Helsinki, the prize money is hidden high up on top of a crane. Can he keep his momentum alive or will he blow up? Stay tuned to find out! Let's get started!

![fte-20200420015811-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/2c32d.png)

The game is kind of a 3D platformer set on city rooftops. You must keep your momentum up to reach the goal.


Controls: Mouse / Arrows to steer, W / Up to boost, S / Down to brake, Space to jump.


Source code is included in the game/src directory under MIT in all the downloads.

![fte-20200420015713-0.png](///raw/a57/41/z/2c337.png)

items.name: There is no plant B.
items.body:
**Rules**
- Keep your plant alive until the timer runs out. 
- Stand near the plant to water it.

- You can only carry one fence at a time.

**Controls**

- Shoo Rabbits: X / M 
- Quit: Esc

Carefully carry your child by a rope and don't let them get hurt!


Space - Jump/ Climb

items.name: BioBot
items.body:
Welcome young padawan, here you are stuck and trying to survive with a bot which is absolutely offensive weaponary but still requires time to cool off too.And you're a guy who can defend against anything at you. So basically you're on defence bots on offense, Enjoy :)

Press - 1 to shoot normal Bullets
Press - 2 to shoot Grenades
Press - 3 and draw on the screen to use Shield
And standard controls for movement and shoot.

Beware over usage of weapon will cause issues to bot so look out for the bot's orb color.!![BioBotCoverImage.png](///raw/c85/11/z/2c2bc.png)![gameImage_1.png](///raw/c85/11/z/2c2bd.png)

items.name: Oregano Thanks
items.body:
Can you protect this rare plant from mysterious meatball/boulder throwing foes?

A/D or arrow keys to move
Left Click to use the watering can, or shoot down enemies
Right Click to take out your shield
Left Click with shield out to place down portable shield if you have one 
Laser Beams fill shield to full

The goal is to protect your little plant from being bombarded and killed. Good Luck!

This is the first game I've made that wasn't just me experimenting with unity, so please enjoy!

See it on itch.io

items.name: Squirrel Saver
items.body:
# Squirrel Saver

On your daily walk through the forest you come across a severely injured squirrel. You have to **keep it alive** and get it to the vet in time!

![ld46_1.png](///raw/3e7/3/z/2c123.png)

## Tools

- plain HTML5/JavaScript, no engines

- Notepad++
- Photoshop
- Audacity
- Wolfram Tones (http://tones.wolfram.com/)
- jfxr (https://jfxr.frozenfractal.com/)

## Links

Play:
https://pingpoli.de/ld46

Source Code:
https://pingpoli.de/ld46/sourcecode.zip

items.name: Terrible Spaceship Design
items.body:
The location is unknown, the resources are non-existant, and whoever designed your spaceship is definitely insane!

In this game you control a spaceship with a slightly weird design decision: the gun is attached to the main body by a single cable. As if moving around wasn't bad enough, your gun is also the only fragile part of the entire thing! On top of that, your energy is running lower every second and you must replenish it by picking random green rectangles I never thought what should be.

Your gun is very fragile, so you better keep it alive!

Engine used was Unity, sounds generated using sfxr.

items.body:
Welcome to the Ultimate Chicken Toaster (aka the Temple of Fire) !

![lvl1.png](///raw/d4b/32/z/2bd34.png)

You easily made your way to the treasure room thanks to your shiny fireproof armor of doom. The chest at the center of the room contains the most powerful item in the world ! THE ULTIMATE CHICKEN !
However be aware that it is really beakable. To finish your mission you must keep it alive through the toasty dungeon.

## Controls :

WASD / Left Joystick : Move

Left Clic / A(Pad) / X (Pad) : Attack

Right Clic / B(Pad) / Y (Pad): Grab / Throw items

items.name: Outpowered
items.body:
We can't survive here any longer, they are just too many. If we repair our generator, we have a chance to get out of here. Find the missing parts, keep the generator powered, destroy anyone trying to stop us!

Stay close to your generator to refill its power bar. When you move away, it will drain slowly. Don't let it deplete, and you'll be fine.

Approaching enemies will move on the generator. Destroy them before they can reach it. Do what you must to keep the generator alive!
![screen.png](///raw/3cc/31/z/2c2e8.png)

items.name: Chrashsite
items.body:
My first Ludum Dare game! And it's even finished! Splendid!

You've chrashed your helicopter, can you rebuild it with only an axe and a fire that threatens to run out of fuel at any time?

Keep track of your fuel and other resources in the upper left corner. If you run out of fuel it's game over for you, buddy. You can create more fuel in addition to numerous buildings and upgrades by using the number keys while close to the fire. You get the resources needed for this by walking up to trees (and later on rocks) and swinging your axe into them. I'll leave it up to you to discover what all the upgrades do, I'm sure you'll do fine.

Good luck!

![SkÃ¤rmbild (107).png](///raw/90b/2/z/2c1e5.png)

![SkÃ¤rmbild (105).png](///raw/90b/2/z/2c1f0.png)

Controls: 
- W and S for forwards and backwards movement.
- A and D to rotate your character and swing your axe.
- Shift to sprint (when unlocked)
- I to toggle ironworks (when unlocked, important to remember since they drink fuel like I've been drinking tea)
- R to restart
- Escape to exit

Tools:
- Unity
- Krita (poorly used as you may see)
- LMMS (also poorly used, playing in a wind orchestra for 10 years hasn't prepared me for this)
- Audacity

Since this is only my second original game ever I know it's not very good but I can't help but be proud of it anyway. Please make sure you give me plenty of harsh critique so I can convince myself I shouldn't be.

items.name: Forever Green
items.body:
INSTRUCTIONS:

Use the Plant seeds button to start planting seeds. The seeds will become beans aftera certain amount of time. You can speed this time up by applying fertilizers to the seeds.

Once they become beans they can be eating by insects and you also need to water them frequently. Deploy pesticide to make the insects stay away from the crops.

You loose the game if all your crops die, or get eaten.

Controls: You control the entire game with the buttons at the bottom. The tractor will follow a set path, so it will be easier for you to keep the early seeds in the path alive.

HINTS: I'm not sure the fertilizer is worth it right now, the growth time may be a bit to short.

CURRENT ISSUES:

THe WebGL builds seems to have some issues with audio, I currently have about halft the sound effects, and another person reported they had none.
The game is also a bit to easy I think

Windows build will be added shortly.

items.name: Your Very Own Rising Pet
items.body:
As many of us IRL are looking for yeast and finding there isn't any in the stores, I've taken to trying to raise a sourdough baby. Here's that experience in game form! 

Your Very Own Rising Pet is a twine game, I made half of the audio and used ChapelR's code for an audio library in Harlowe, but other than that I did it all myself! 

All you need is a mouse or your finger on touch compatible devices, and there are audio controls on the left-hand side. I hope you enjoy!

items.name: Courier of Fire
items.body:
Courier of Fire, made in 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 46 Compo, Keep it Alive.

Made with Unity, Gimp 2, and SFXR.

![Courier of Fire Screenshot 1.png](///raw/e28/d/z/2c2ea.png)

This is my first attempt at a puzzle game, it's not awful if I do say so myself.

In Courier of Fire you deliver fire to braziers, so it's important to keep the fires going!

![Courier of Fire Screenshot 3.png](///raw/e28/d/z/2c2ec.png)

Thanks for checking out my game!

items.name: The Next Generation (Conway's Game of Life Puzzles)
items.body:
Inspired by the recent passing of [John Conway](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Horton_Conway), I made a [Game of Life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conway%27s_Game_of_Life) puzzle game.

Each level gives you a goal pattern. Click the cells to create a start pattern, and then click the play button to apply the Game of Life rules. You win when the generated pattern matches the goal.

[![tng.PNG](///raw/da0/2/z/2c2d0.png)](https://happycoding.io/gallery/the-next-generation-ld-46/index)

Play [here](https://happycoding.io/gallery/the-next-generation-ld-46/index)!

items.name: FTL ON
items.body: A  little space game about collecting fuel to keep the FTL drive alive. See how many orbs you can collect!

items.name: The Great Return
items.body:
A chicken has gotten lost in the forest. Only you, "the farmer", can keep it alive and bring it home. Only problem is the Chicken is afraid of you. How will you get the chicken to cross the road(s)?![Gameplay2.png](///raw/d7b/81/z/2bf19.png)

![Gameplay4.png](///raw/d7b/81/z/2bf1b.png)

https://youtu.be/WHNrWDULNnA

How to play: The chicken will move away from you if you get close to it. Use this to get it over the roads. Move the farmer with the mouse. The farmer will always move toward the mousecursor. Press left mousebutton to give the chicken an extra boost. (You need to be close to the chicken otherwise it will not work).

items.name: They are corrupted
items.body:
What a beautiful morning. You wake up, look out of the windo- what the?!

Get all 3 possible endings to unlock "THE TRUTH"!

![aSLEEP.png](///raw/345/62/z/2c0c0.png)

![Controls.png](///raw/345/62/z/2c1a6.png)

WARNING: This game contains (badly drawn, pixelart) blood. If that's not something you want to see, don't play it.

p.s: The game turned out kinda difficult so, if you don't want to play it anymore, you can press shift+t in the TitleScreen to unlock "THE TRUTH". You can also press shift+r to reset your progress.

items.name: Xtreme gardening 2020
items.body:
A gardener tries to keep a flower alive by watering it. It might even grow!
![build1.png](///raw/5d3/c2/z/2bcef.png)
![build2.png](///raw/5d3/c2/z/2bd12.png)
The game is written in Go, using the [ebiten](https://ebiten.org/) library. Graphics were made with Gimp, sound were recorded thanks to Audacity.

items.name: Idle City of the not Unliving
items.body:
This is an idle clicker game with two lists of hirelings.
keep the city alive!

[screenshot.jpg](///raw/edd/c2/z/2c0b2.jpg)

Instructions:

Click on the city to get free gold.
Click Supply or Guard to choose from which list you wish to hire by spending gold.

Suppliers provide the city's necessities and give you gold periodically. You will need more as the city grows!

Guards provide protection from the ghosts below. You will need more and more to address the growing ghost population.

When all your guards are dead the suppliers are attacked next, and that quickly drops the Supply Surplus causing a game over.

Higher rank hirelings are somehow better, but cost a lot more.
Hire the best Guard or best Supplier to win.

Idle City of the not Unliving - because double negatives are not unconfusing!

items.name: DodgeCar!
items.body:
All pygame - About you being a car, having to dodge all the blocks hurtling towards you. Keep yourself, and the game session alive! #keepitalive

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oba6oLfAga4

items.name: Fuel Me
items.body:
# FuelMe
Game created in 48h for Ludum Dare 46
Graphics are drawn by Thea.

Pick up coins and deliver them to the goal, but be careful you're running out of gas! OH NO! Now the fuel tank broke!

Movement:
Arrow keys

items.name: SIPHON
items.body:
Your life is slipping away. Siphon the horde to keep yourself alive.

A top-down shooter where you're constantly losing health. You need to siphon it back from enemies, but doing so leaves you vulnerable. Use a mix of the rail gun and rocket launcher to defend yourself and make it to the end.

Controls:
* WASD to move
* LMB for rail gun
* RMB for rockets
* Hold E to siphon an enemy (when in range)
* Left shift to dash

Let me know what you think!

There's also a developer console you can play (press the tilde/backtick key ~/`). Type "level N" to go to a particular level, and "nocooldowns" to turn off ability cooldowns (warning: this will trigger the ability every frame - could tank low-end PCs).

![Annotation 2020-04-20 083342.png](///raw/fe8/z/2c0ba.png)

items.name: DITAZURE
Darryl in Distress
items.body:
Save Darryl the baby turtle from danger! Darryl is a very curious, very newly born, very adorable little turtle that just wants to make friends. Little does Darryl know, that the innocent looking things on this cruel new world he has been bought into wants to kill and eat him! Darryl will interrupt you and try go back to the evils on the beach. You have to look after Darryl and keep him alive! Make sure he reaches the shore and joins the rest of his adorable turtle kind.

Move with the WASD keys, when Darryl moves to a dangerous area mash A & D to stop him from moving towards the danger.

items.name: ezreactor
items.body: Keep a demented nuclear reactor alive. How will your Chernobyl happen?

items.name: Don't Leaf Me
items.body:
Controls: A and D to move, space bar to jump
This is a platformer about a plant who was left behind by his family and needs to find water. His vision is fading, but you can help him.

Music was created using Beepbox. Art was created with Aseprite. Game was created in Unity.![screen1.png](///raw/71a/03/z/2c0a9.png)![screen2.png](///raw/71a/03/z/2c0ad.png)

items.name: Twitch Feeds
items.body:
A game where you feed a guy roaming across the screen by using the Twitch commands.

You have to count with the lag and be accurate.

You can also switch the food you create.

The more players playing at the same time, the more fun! (your experience may vary tho)

I'll try to make the game running on Twitch as much as possible.

I'll try to create also a WebGL version simulating the play for singleplayer.

Compo note: The graphics were made by my 5 yo daughter. I'll let you decide whether I'm still eligible for compo or not.

items.name: Rolly and the Flower
items.body:
### Rolly the Robot fell in love with a beautiful flower. 


![RollyInLove.png](///raw/46b/d1/z/2c269.png)

He would like to bring her to his garden and take care of her for eternity. But even if it's safe for a robot, the path that leads there is full of danger for such a fragile creature. 

Take good care of her!

## Keys 

- **A** - **D** (or **Q** - **D** on AZERTY keyboards) to move left and right.
- **Space bar** to throw the flower if you are carrying her.
- **R** to restart a level
- **U** to show / hide audio settings


**The game was designed for 16:10 screens. The window in the browser has this ratio and will give more comfort if not set to full-screen.**

items.name: The Bob and the Rob
items.body:
This game relates to my previous game (in Ludum Dare 45, check it out!).

In it you need to give your grandparents all they wish for before they die. 

HAVE FUN!!!

items.name: Pug Panic
items.body:
OH NO! Your pet pug has gotten loose on your spaceship! You're locked in the bridge, though, so you'll have to try and protect it through your archaic, virus-ridden systems monitor. How long can you keep him safe?

This is a purely mouse-based game, so no controls, other than clicking and dragging stuff - track-pad not recommended.

Instructions are accessible in-game through the help button on the menu.

Tools used:
- Unity
- Pyxel Edit
- GIMP
- REAPER
- Audacity
- BFXR
- Some custom tools available on my GitHub (developed for personal use only): https://github.com/AlexDavies8/Unity-Plugins

My experience this time around:
I really struggled to come up with an idea past a generic platformer for the first couple hours, but once I settled on it, this is the most inventive I think I've been so far. It was also much quicker through development than my previous submissions, and somehow I never felt pressured for time, even after polishing! It was also nice to work with more familiar programs, and to be able to use a DAW better than Bosca for music (REAPER can be got as a free trial version, but it seemingly never expires).

items.name: Little Sunshine
items.body:
This is not just the first game project for the LDGame Jam but also the first game I ever release and the first game I showed to the public, made entirely by myself! The theme was Keep it alive. You have to nourish the little sunshine with water and sunlight while defending against hordes of evil bugs! Stay alive for two minutes and win the ultimate price :)

It was a fantastic experience creating this game for the last 48 hours! I know that this game is not perfect and I know so many things to improve. Still, I would love to hear your opinion on it and recommendations to improve "little sunshine" enjoy playing!
![Little Sunshine 2.PNG](///raw/016/1/z/2c087.png)

items.name: Feed me!
items.body:
In the wasteland of the future, you survive by keeping a mutant plant called Vizbig alive. It demands water, toxic sludge and bones constantly. As it grows it gets harder to keep up with its demands and store the fruit you need.

![Screenshot 2020-04-19 23.25.24.png](///raw/8c8/2/z/2c09a.png)

Controls: Arrow keys to move and space bar to grab/drop/fill/feed.

Water in the west, sludge down south and bones to the east. Use the bucket to get water, use the tank to get toxic sludge. You can pick up fruit and bones by hand.

![Screenshot 2020-04-19 23.26.02.png](///raw/8c8/2/z/2c09d.png)

Drop water, sludge and bones onto Vizbig's roots to feed it.

Collect the fruit and take it to your home up north to score.

![Screenshot 2020-04-19 23.27.59.png](///raw/8c8/2/z/2c0a0.png)

It's not the best but I'm happy I got it done. Would have liked to ironed out some of the pick up/drop behaviour but it works for the most part!

Built using:
- Phaser 3
- VSCodium
- Aseprite
- Bfxr
- Tiled
- Wolfram Tones

items.name: It's Not Rocket Science
items.body:
https://youtu.be/3GtdW0GuPto

You are stranded in space as you realise that your ship has no steering, how long can you keep your crew alive before succumbing to the lack of oxygen. 

This is a tricky arcade space game about keeping the crew of your ship alive for as long as possible. The longer your crew are alive, the more points you get.

To steer your ship, you must place down gravity wells; these will attract your ship to allow you to turn but be careful - you will lose if you crash into them!

Planets will also allow your ship to turn however these are less predictable and you have no control over them.

You can fire your engines to escape from orbits or increase your ship's velocity but use your fuel carefully, if it runs out you will be unable to use your engines.

Bubbles of fuel and air can be found floating in space, these can be used to refill the respective meter.

If you run out of air, you lose as your crew suffocate.

items.name: X33D
items.body:
Hello entity. The X33D machine has generated some X33Ds uniquely for you. Take them, grow them, BR33D new X33Ds. Then share what you create.

X33D is a slow game where you grow strange seeds into polygonal alien growths. Each seed is unique and grows in a unique way. Each generation of your seeds is slightly mutated from the last. Take your favourite seeds and breed them together to create new seeds beyond what previously existed. Discover new seed genes, and new seed types. Keep your genes alive, but encourage them to change and flourish.

Play online: [https://x33d.taybenlor.workers.dev](https://x33d.taybenlor.workers.dev)

![xeed-cover.png](///raw/c7c/c2/z/2c0f0.png)

![Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 8.42.41 am.png](///raw/c7c/c2/z/2c104.png)

Thanks to everyone who supported me and chatted online. What a weird game jam time. Short list of tools used for those interested:

- Vanilla JS, HTML, CSS, SVG for Interface
- Three.js for the weird growing polygons
- Sketch for designing
- GarageBand for music and sound effects

items.body:

You have already failed twice.

Your operator resets you back to the anchor point, and you try again. And again. And again. 

![screenshot 2.png](///raw/0ab/e2/z/2c102.png)

items.name: Keep It Alive, Keep Enemies Dead
items.body:
I once again wanted to cross breed tetris with something, this time the idea of idle game came in very nice.
So, little white square is a guy that will fight other red squares. You can't control him, but you see his attack and hp. They hit each other taking turns, until one dies, after that new red square comes (might be stronger!).

Player's objective is to collect tetris shapes.
Shapes have a chance to drop on enemies hit and when enemy dies 3 shapes are always dropped. You have to catch them all!

Shapes can be placed in one of 3 fields (or thrown away).

**Blue left field**

Any full horizontal lines will dissapear and player will be healed by 1 for each block

**Red right field**

Players attack gets charged, increasing damage on next attack (only one attack). If 25 blocks collected, damage permanently increased

**Green bottom field**

This is sort of inventory field, shapes can be placed there temporarly and taken when needed, unlike other fields where shapes are put permanently



Hope you like it!

p.s. this is my first entry where I tried to make my own music, didn't have much time for that unfortunately. The track was created DAWless with Korg Volca Keys, Korg Volca Bass, Korg Volca Beats, sequenced by Beatstep pro and Keystep.

items.name: Hungry, Hungry, Hungry, Very, Very Hungry Cat
items.body:
![Cover.png](///raw/b17/5/z/2bfe4.png)

HOW TO PLAY

Your goal in HUNGRY HUNGRY HUNGRY VERY VERY HUNGRY CAT is to feed the VERY HUNGRY CAT before it dies!
But be careful! The cat is very, very hungry and your FINGERS do look very, very delicious!

Use your MOUSE to move your HAND with the FISH.
Get the FISH close to the CAT until it BITES!


1. Feed the FISH to the CAT.
2. Get MORE FISH from the POND.
3. Feed MORE FISH to the CAT.
4. KEEP THE CAT ALIVE!




ABOUT THE DEVELOPMENT PROCESS

The idea was...

- Super cozy indoor Cat Environment!
- Ever-hungry Cat character that is always hungry, hungry, hungry!
- Upgradable furniture to make "CAT" feel comfy!
- A whole bunch of animals to feed the cat!



The game turned out as...

- CAT feels very comfy... which is the MOST important thing ladies and gentlemen!
- UEBER cozy Outdoor Cat Environment!
- Ever-hungry Cat character that is always hungry, hungry, very very hungry!
- The Cat gets one BIG fish to eat and should stop complaining, goddamnit!




Thx team #LudumDare and thx to everyone who developed a game here. This community is fantastic!

Jot

ILIKESCIFI Games

Have fun out there!

items.name: Keep It Pumping
items.body:
Warning: Contains blood, gore, and suicide.
![pumping2.png](///raw/5aa/03/z/2c11c.png)




# Instructions: 
Pump his heart when it's full of blood.(When the spinner is in the green section.)
Left click to shoot demons. (No aiming required.)
He will periodically aim the gun to his own head. Try to keep him alive, ok.

# Controls:

Space : Pump heart
Left click : Shoot

# Info:
Game was made in GameMaker Studio 1. It's the first gamejam I have ever tried so I tried to keep it simple, I'm just glad I finished something.
Absolutely everything created from fresh, by me.

Full source code as well as sounds and sprites are available in the compressed gamemaker .gmz file located [Here](http://globalboring.org/Ludem/KeepingItAlive.gmz)



Play it [Here](http://globalboring.org/Ludem/index.html)

If you don't have the gamemaker studio client, and want anything just let me know and I'll export it separately and send it to ya.


# More:

If you want to see more stuff by me [Click here](http://www.globalboring.org.) 

If you want to keep in contact via [twitter](https://twitter.com/9fingergames.)

items.name: Guardian Angel
items.body:
You are a guardian angel, but humanity is making your job very difficult. Soldiers face off on the battlefield with grenades, bombs, and spears, and your job is to Keep them alive!

Objective: 
Use your body and angelic aura to protect soldiers from each others projectiles. The battle will keep getting more intense until one side wins, at which point its game over. Keep them alive as long as possible!

Controls:
WASD/Arrow keys: Move
Space: Activate Aura (Heal humans and knock away objects)

Tips:
- Soldiers don't have strong allegiances, knocking them to the other side will cause them to change sides! Use this to balance power if one side is on their last legs.
- Spears become harmless after touching the ground.
- My high score is 129 seconds! Can you do better?

This game was made for Ludum dare 46, which had the theme 'Keep it alive'

## Troubleshooting

### Window too big
For some reason love.js decides at random to make the window way too big on Web. If that happens to you, adjust the page size using CMD + and CMD - on Mac, or CTRL + and CTRL - on Windows.

### Won't stop loading
love.js doesn't seem compatible with Firefox Private mode, so that may be the issue.

items.name: Save the Hamster
items.body:
Hi, folks :wave: 

It's my first experience in a hackathon. ~~I know I'm just lazy `***`.~~ It isn't such a good game with crazy gameplay and amazing graphic that you may expect. There are just some strange circles into a playground bound via rules.

So I ask you to use your **IMAGINATION** a bit. 

...2020. Self-isolation and loneliness. We need to stay home to protect our friends and families, we aren't? But one `*****` always needs to move somewhere. It's a hamster. :hamster: When it stops, it dies. When it moves, it lives. Only other blue medical orderly hamsters can stop this crazy hamster using a special sleeping pill. You know these pills don't work properly. They are killing every hamster around. 

So I offer to play hamster and KEEP IT ALIVE as longer as you can. Let's break the serious rules only in the games. Are you agreed?

I hope you'll enjoy moving ~~an orange circle~~ the hamster and avoiding these nasty white ~~bullets~~ pills.

https://youtu.be/GU4052eCvGM

items.name: Heat of the Moment
items.body:
âAre you the kind of person who would selflessly rescue a dying baby animal, you know, if the stakes weren't âsuperâ high. Have you ever wanted to prove as much to your friends, so they'll stop saying "Yeah, right", but the opportunity never seems to present itself naturally?

If so, then this may be the game for you. In less than 2 minutes, you could be smugly declaring "There, see?" or "I told you so" and living with the satisfaction that yeah, maybe you âareâ that kind of person, who thinks about the safety of mildly-inconveniently-timed calls to adventure, a true maverick hero, a paragon of the pro-small-animals-not-being-left-to-die-in-an-alley movement.

![Screenshot (6).png](///raw/f02/f2/z/2bfaa.png)![Screenshot (7).png](///raw/f02/f2/z/2bfab.png)

items.name: Gibi Committee for Shadok Preservation
items.body:
Shadoks live on a tiny, unstable planet. Any area with a shadok on one side and no shadok on the other falls down because of its occupant's weight. Unluckily, these little birds just won't figure it out.

That's why the Gibis came over from their nearby planet to save them! Set the gibis on the right places so that the shadoks don't fall into space!

![Gibi Committee For Shadok Preservation 2020.04.19 - 23.20.02.01.png](///raw/a6c/f2/z/2c0ab.png)

The game is played with mouse only. No fancy controls.

It's been developed over two days for Ludum Dare 46's compo. I've made everything from scratch except the font (Bahnschrift) using Unity, C#, Blender, sfxr, Bosca Ceoil, Audacity and Adobe Photoshop. To create the original spacerock texture, I transformed two free texture packs available on https://3dtextures.me.â Also, everything is inspired, of course, by the original design of the Shadoks. That's why I opted-out the "Mood" category.

This is one of my first experiences. I started C#, Unity and Blender 8 months ago and had to learn by myself. Every piece of advice or critique will be very appreciated, but please remember I'm new to it.

items.name: Why did you throw the baby?
items.body:
A question we have probably all asked ourself at least once or twice during our lives. Yet we all know that feeling whenever you find a sleeping baby, the urge to throw it into the air to gain points. Keeping the dream alive. The dream that maybe, just maybe, the throw will make the baby reach orbit, and it will be gone forever.

![Cover.png](///raw/c41/f2/z/2bfef.png)

3 Tips to become a hero:

- Give the baby what it wants. 

- Don't hold the baby too long, we all know babies are little puke machines. 

- Birds are stupid and annoying and always in the way and I hate them so very very much. 

Good luck and please share your highscores!

items.name: Hold That Thought
items.body:
You've had an idea! Can you keep it alive?

Play here: https://2kah.itch.io/hold-that-thought

It might be a philosophy, a cult, a business idea, a new religion, fake news. Whatever it is, you want to keep the thought alive by persuading as many people as you can.

### Controls
- Movement - WASD / arrow keys / left mouse click and drag
- Pause - Escape

### Basic Instructions
- Stand near people to persuade them
- Once convinced they will persuade others, including you!
- Conviction drops over time, don't lose faith in your own thought

### Detailed Instructions
- Persuade a certain number of people before the time runs out to win
- Spend your points at the start! The game might be impossible if you don't
- The more people you convince, the harder your enemies will try to dissuade them and the faster conviction will drop
- Green people are highly convinced, yellow are middling, orange are weakly convinced (but they still think you're right)
- If you lose conviction, stand near someone who believes in your idea
- Some people are more sceptical than others so are harder to convince
- Everyone has their own charisma and confidence, just because someone is in your persuasion range doesn't mean you're in theirs

![HoldThatThought.png](///raw/2dd/2/z/2be90.png)

![StartScreen.png](///raw/2dd/2/z/2be96.png)

items.name: Another f****ng escort mission
items.body:
This is my participation for the ld46 :D


In this game, you must escort one of the worst NPC... 
Will you be able to keep your sanity alive ?

This game was made in 48h for the ludum dare 46, even the mouth-crafted sound effects (I think this explains the quality of the sound effects).

Controls
--------
 
- **wasd/zqsd**  to move
- **mouse** to aim
- **right click** to aim, release to fire an arrow
- **space/enter** to validate in menu and advance in the dialogues

The small red circle around the NPC indicate the zone of danger, if a monster get into this zone, the NPC will kinda insult you, resulting in your character getting angrier.
The larger orange circle is for clarity, allowing you to easily differentiate living monsters and corpse.

Scoring
-------

For the score, here are the values : 

| Combo       | Score gained        |
|-------------|---------------------|
| 1 killed    | 100 points          |
| 2 killed    | 250 points          |
| 3 killed    | 450 points          |
| 4 killed    | 700 points          |
| 5 killed    | 950 points          |
| 6 killed    | 1250 points         |
| more than 6 | 50\*floor(x*x^(2/3)) |

Have fun !

items.name: Precious Animals
items.body:
I got into developing hyper-casual games lately. Even though I had planned using some different development systems for each jams, after announcement of theme I decided to develop a hyper-casual game. I wanted to extend it to a casual but that will be on full release I think.

Game is simple, you are trying to protect animals gathered at the center of the screen. There are some alien ships who want to destroy animals. Your goal is preventing aliens as long as possible while not letting animals die from hunger. I am thinking adding some powerups to give some variety to gameplay and maybe a different part to see gathered animals (this is supported in this version to but I did not finished implementation). If you can give me ideas about gameplay that will be very helpfull.

I codded whole game by myself there is only free LeanTween library in addition to my codes. I developed game in Unity. At the start my goal was participating in Jam but whole game finished yesterday so I decided to run for compo. I tried to try out some different tools and styles for graphics and I am aware that neither graphics not musics are good. I don't have a sense of art I think.

Anyway time to make a game for Jam this time. Enjoy Precious Animals and keep them safe as long as possible for me please.

items.name: Branch Out
items.body:
Branch Out is a game all about... branching out! Your goal is to expand your tree and keep it alive. Build branches and roots to obtain resources. Then, use those resources to build more and get upgrades.

![ImageBar1.png](///raw/b6b/22/z/2be75.png)

## Instructions
* Start by building some simple roots. Roots collect water and nutrients. Nutrients are essential for building more in the future.
* Add some branches up top. Sunlight can be used for upgrades.
* Get upgrades! The bugs can become a problem. You don't want them hanging around.
* Get even bigger. There is nothing stopping you. Only rule, stay alive!

### Resources
The three resources are water, nutrient, and sun. If any three of these reach 0 your tree will start to die. Be extra careful with nutrient, it is essential to expand and it is impossible to obtain it again if you run out.

### Building
To start building roots or branches, press the build button located on the top of the screen. Then, use your mouse to select a starting location. This location must be on the tree. Next, pick an ending location. This location will be the point the branch will grow out to. If the line is red, it can not be built. The amount of nutrient required to build is shown next to your cursor.

*Note: Branches can't go down and roots can't go up. Also, they can not cross.*

![Screen Shot 2020-04-19 at 5.25.20 PM.png](///raw/b6b/22/z/2be7b.png)

## Controls

| Input | Function |
|---|---|
| `W` `A` `S` `D`  `Arrows` | Move Camera |
| `Left Mouse` |  Select |

copied from my itch page:

# [LUDUM DARE 46 SUBMISSION]

**In this fast paced burger cooking game you must make hamburgers for the big scary monster before it's too late! Even while under attack by his minions.**

**THERE'S A TUTORIAL IN THE GAME (NOT THE BEST) BUT HERE'S AN EXTRA INCASE YOU'RE TOO LAZY OR ITS TOO DIFFICULT TO READ:**

- Head over to the stove (Labeled in the tutorial)

- Press Z and play the minigame (Press the keys that show up)

- Once you see a flying burger, head over to the plate table (Labeled in the tutorial)

- Press Z on the plate table and head over to the burger and press Z

- Once both the burger and plate is on top of u, get close to the monster and press [ARROW UP].

- DON'T LET THE BAR ABOVE HIM DROP DOWN (trust me)

## CONTROLS:

[Z] - Interact

[X] - Shoot

[UP ARROW] - Feed

[LEFT RIGHT ARROW KEY] - Move

items.name: Your Pet Alien
items.body:
In **Your Pet Alien**, your objective is to care for your pet while also keeping your family from finding it. 

Use your **Closet** to **hide it**, and use your **Bed** to **heal it**. Every sound that you or your pet makes attracts your mom's attention, so you must be very strategic. 

Furthermore, doing chores makes your mom less likely to enter your room, and you get an extra bonus if she watches you do chores. You also need to be aware of where in the house she is and how close she is to your room.

*Note: nothing is inherently scary about this game, but the atmosphere may creep some people out. This was influenced by games by Scott Cawthon as well as Baldi's Basic's :)*

items.name: Cool Plants / Chill Beats
items.body:
Hearkening back to the days of Tamagachi and recent idle games, jump into this chill relaxing game to raise some plants.

![coolplantshot_01.jpg](///raw/2fa/f2/z/2bf8c.jpg)

Relax with some cool tunes as you get more plants and take care of them. The longer you keep them alive, the more money you get to get new plants. Don't want to leave the game open? Just save and close it. Progress is tracked in real time so you can play at your own pace. Just don't leave for too long or you could lose your plants. 

Look out for interactions that pop up to get even more money to get more plants.

The majority of assets are from various asset packs from the Unreal Market Place with some help on a few extras. Game creation all done by me.

Created in Unreal Engine 4.

items.name: P4R3NTing 101
items.body:

The Incubation-Control for the ships infant passengers is malfunctioning and they are waking up from their sleep way too early.

Luckily the ship is able to fix this error, but it will take some time during which the newborns need tending.

This is where you come into play!

You are a caretaker robot model 'p4r3-nt' and it is your job to feed, clean and put the newborns to bed.

Good Luck!!

-------------------------

The game is heavily inspired by games like 'Overcooked!' and therefor also offers a Local-Coop gamemode.
It was made in under 48 hours and might be my best gamejam game yet!

A game by [@AndideBob](https://twitter.com/andidebob)

With music by [@DJBBone](https://twitter.com/DJBBone)

items.name: JarHeads
items.body:
![shot1.png](///raw/133/z/2bfe2.png)

### Controls

 - **Arrow keys** to move.
 - Hold **space** and use the **arrow keys** to move with ***IT***. Must be on the same tile.

### Gameplay

 - Purple bullets hurt you, blue bullets hurt ***IT***.
 - Holding ***IT*** drains your stamina bar. If it runs out, you will need to wait a bit before being able to carry ***IT*** again.
 - Keep ***IT*** (and yourself) alive!
 - Tip: you get extra score when ***IT*** passes through purple bullets.

### JarHeads, the Story

It is the distant future, the year 201X.

Mad scientists across the world have united to create the maddest experiment yet. Collectively, they are known as the League of Earth's Worseningly Deranged Scientists. Their experiment: putting heads into jars.

After lengthy negotiations with the World's United Sanest Scientists, the key ingredient to the experiment was identified: heads in jars *without the body attached*.

Is is now the even more distant future, the year 201Y.

You, wearing a kind of a jar on your head, and a creature you can only refer to as ***IT*** are the last of your kind.

You are the **JarHeads**.

![shot2.png](///raw/133/z/2bfe3.png)

Also for some reason you have to avoid waves of bullets.

items.name: Precious Animals
items.body:
I got into developing hyper-casual games lately. Even though I had planned using some different development systems for each jams, after announcement of theme I decided to develop a hyper-casual game. I wanted to extend it to a casual but that will be on full release I think.

Game is simple, you are trying to protect animals gathered at the center of the screen. There are some alien ships who want to destroy animals. Your goal is preventing aliens as long as possible while not letting animals die from hunger. I am thinking adding some powerups to give some variety to gameplay and maybe a different part to see gathered animals (this is supported in this version to but I did not finished implementation). If you can give me ideas about gameplay that will be very helpfull.

I codded whole game by myself there is only free LeanTween library in addition to my codes. I developed game in Unity. At the start my goal was participating in Jam but whole game finished yesterday so I decided to run for compo. I tried to try out some different tools and styles for graphics and I am aware that neither graphics not musics are good. I don't have a sense of art I think.

Anyway time to make a game for Jam this time. Enjoy Precious Animals and keep them safe as long as possible for me please.

items.name: Branch Out
items.body:
Branch Out is a game all about... branching out! Your goal is to expand your tree and keep it alive. Build branches and roots to obtain resources. Then, use those resources to build more and get upgrades.

![ImageBar1.png](///raw/b6b/22/z/2be75.png)

## Instructions
* Start by building some simple roots. Roots collect water and nutrients. Nutrients are essential for building more in the future.
* Add some branches up top. Sunlight can be used for upgrades.
* Get upgrades! The bugs can become a problem. You don't want them hanging around.
* Get even bigger. There is nothing stopping you. Only rule, stay alive!

### Resources
The three resources are water, nutrient, and sun. If any three of these reach 0 your tree will start to die. Be extra careful with nutrient, it is essential to expand and it is impossible to obtain it again if you run out.

### Building
To start building roots or branches, press the build button located on the top of the screen. Then, use your mouse to select a starting location. This location must be on the tree. Next, pick an ending location. This location will be the point the branch will grow out to. If the line is red, it can not be built. The amount of nutrient required to build is shown next to your cursor.

*Note: Branches can't go down and roots can't go up. Also, they can not cross.*

![Screen Shot 2020-04-19 at 5.25.20 PM.png](///raw/b6b/22/z/2be7b.png)

## Controls

| Input | Function |
|---|---|
| `W` `A` `S` `D`  `Arrows` | Move Camera |
| `Left Mouse` |  Select |

items.name: Corona Grocery Run
items.body:
This is a pandemic! But your mom still asks you to do your grocery run daily. Will you practice social distancing or act willy nilly? Make your choice and decide how you die!

===============Control================

[W/S/Space]: to circle through choices.

[Enter]: to make decision and progress further.

=====================================

PS: This is my first full game. Since I usually have problem with commitment, I decide to join Ludum Dare to force myself to pick up game development. I've yet learnt how to make graphic, animation and sound  so here goes a text based game. The 2 days have been very fulfilling for me. Please go ham on me!

Made with Haxe - Heaps.
